Template:Click/doc:
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==
'''''*NOTE*''''' in spite of all of the available documentation about MediaWiki software saying this should work, it doesn't.  I'll have to pound on this some more and get some feedback from Wikia to see what I'm doing wrong here!  --[[User:Robert Horning|Robert Horning]] 01:42, 19 January 2009 (UTC)


'''Template:Click''' is used to allow images to be "clicked" that will link to some other page than the image page.  This is an improvement over [[:Template:Clickpic]] and is intended to replace that template where clickable images are used.

===Parameters===

*'''image''' = the name of the image that you want to display
*'''size''' = the size of the image, in pixels.  Example:  ''size=100 px''
*'''link''' = the page location (including alternate descriptions) for where clicking on the image will link to.

=== Example ===

<pre>
{{Click
|image=Wom plotting.jpg
|size=200px
|link=Wise Old Man
|title=Sometimes you just have a rough day
}}
</pre>

{{Click
|image=Wom plotting.jpg
|size=200px
|link=Wise Old Man
|title=Sometimes you just have a rough day
}}

== Template Documentation ==  <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

The '''Coins''' template shows the amount of coins with a preview image.  The amount is formatted with a comma (if the value is greater than 1000), and with the following colors:
* <font color=red>Red</font> - negative numbers
* <font color=blue>Blue</font> - positive numbers
* <font color=green>Green</font> - if the number is zero

== Usage ==
<pre>
{{Coins
  | Amount = number of coins
}}
</pre>

== Examples ==
The following are some examples:
<pre>&#123;{Coins|Amount=-3000}}</pre>
Produces the following result: {{Coins|Amount=-3000}}

<pre>&#123;{Coins|Amount=245.50}}</pre>
Produces the following result: {{Coins|Amount=245.50}}

<pre>&#123;{Coins|Amount=0}}</pre>
Produces the following result: {{Coins|Amount=0}}

Template:Clear/doc:
The '''clear''' template is used when the text needs to be moved below, for example, after an image or an infobox.

==Usage==
<pre>{{clear}}</pre>
:substitutes: '''<nowiki><div style="clear:both;"></div></nowiki>'''

<pre>{{clear|left}}</pre>
:substitutes: '''<nowiki><div style="clear:left;"></div></nowiki>'''

<pre>{{clear|right}}</pre>
:substitutes: '''<nowiki><div style="clear:right;"></div></nowiki>'''

Template:Clickpic/doc:
This templates allows images to be used as links pointing to a desired page. i.e. a [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Help:Navigational_image navigational image].

==Syntax==
<pre><nowiki>{{clickpic|Target page title|Full image path}}</nowiki></pre>

'''Note:'''
This only works for Mediawiki sites that support [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Help:Images_and_other_uploaded_files#Embedding_external_images|embedding external images] such as the [[RuneScape Wiki]]. However, when using this template it is recommended that the image used is actually an internally-held image (i.e. uploaded unto the wiki).

Some Wikimedia sites do not support embedding external images, but plenty of other personal, public and corporate intranet Mediawiki-based sites do, and these can use this template to make navigational images easy to implement. 

==Usage==
If this template is duplicated on a Mediawiki site, here is the code:
<pre><nowiki><span class="plainlinks">[{{fullurl:{{{1}}}}} {{{2}}}]</span></nowiki></pre>

For information such as:
* How to obtain the full path of the image which is needed for this template
* What to do if there is a whitespace problem in Internet Explorer or Opera

Please see further details from [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:CharlesC/Template_for_navigational_images_on_Mediawiki_websites the original template creator].

==Example==
An example of a navigational image built with this template is: 
{{clickpic|magic|http://runescape.wikia.com/images/f/fb/Magic.gif}}
where clicking on the image links to the [[magic]] skill page on the website. Note that the template only supports internal links, as the template will always pre-fix the target argument with the path to the root of the wiki.

Note that clicking on a standard image such as [[image:Magic.gif]] refers to the actual image upload file and associated descriptions.

<!-- It would be nice if the hover text could be adjusted too, but that appears pretty complex as the HTML link syntax generation does not allow easy configuring the hover text. -->

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>
<includeonly>[[Category:Image templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]</includeonly>
Template:Clickpic:
<span class="plainlinks">[{{fullurl:{{{1}}}}} {{{2}}}]</span><noinclude>
<!-- The <noinclude> being on the end of the first line above is deliberate - if it is put on the line below, then the template does not work properly and adds an unwanted line break when the template is used-->
{{/doc}}
</noinclude>
Template:Combat level/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an iterim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

==Template Documentation==
The '''combat level''' template returns the combat level based on the specified combat components. The formula is the result of a large reverse engineering activity using player contributed data. See the [http://forum.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/forums.ws?22,23,466,33330028 Combat Formula Thread] on the RuneScape forums for more details. The formula is remarkably accurate. The [[Combat level]] description shows the formula used in this template. It contains several non-linear components (various <i>floor</i> operations), which complicate reverse engineering as different skill levels can still produce the same combat level. The reported error margin in the combat formula (under 0.6%) can be explained by accidental typing errors in some of the skill level contributions used in the reverse engineering project.

== Usage ==
<tt><nowiki>{{ Combat level | ''combat level parameters'' }} </nowiki></tt>
The combat parameters follow the [[Template:User stats]] format. Note that when a parameter is absent, the template will use a default value of 10 for <tt>Hitpoints</tt> and 1 for all other skill levels.

An optional '''DP''' parameter may also be specified determine the number of decimal places to use for the returned combat level (can be 0, 1, 2 or 3). The default is 0 decimal places.

== Example ==
The following template call describes a new player without any combat experience. This also are the default values that the template uses when the parameter is absent or misspelled.
<pre><nowiki>{{Combat level
|Attack=1
|Defence=1
|Strength=1
|Hitpoints=10
|Prayer=1
|Ranged=1
|Magic=1
|Summoning=1
}}</nowiki></pre>
The template text above produces the following result:
{{Combat level
|Attack=1 
|Defence=1
|Strength=1
|Hitpoints=10
|Prayer=1
|Ranged=1
|Magic=1
|Summoning=1
}}

The table shows that a starting player will have a combat level of 3. Another example shows a slightly more advanced player:
<pre><nowiki>{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=18}}</nowiki></pre>
gives the following result:
{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=18}}

On a free to play world, the combat level of this player can be obtained by including:
<pre><nowiki>{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=1}}</nowiki></pre>
This gives  the following rusult:
{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=1}}
So the additional combat levels derived from the Summoning skill are not visible on the free to play worlds.

The following example shows the same advanced player but showing the combat level to 2 decimal places:
<pre><nowiki>{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=18|DP=2}}</nowiki></pre>
gives the following result:
{{Combat level|Attack=92|Defence=84|Strength=91
|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=18|DP=2}}

== How it works ==
The gory details of the template are viewable by entering the ''edit'' mode for this page. The template also has no way of assigning default values for input parameters, mandating that prior to using an input parameter, the template needs to check if the variable is set during the call or set that input variable at its default value.

<includeonly>[[Category:User templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] [[Category:Transclusion templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]</includeonly>
<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>
Template:Combat/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an iterim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

==Template Documentation==
The '''combat''' template displays the four components that determine the [[Combat level]] of a RuneScape character. The formula is the result of a large reverse engineering activity using player contributed data. See the [http://forum.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/forums.ws?22,23,466,33330028 Combat Formula Thread] on the RuneScape forums for more details. The formula is remarkably accurate. The [[Combat level]] description shows the formula used in this template. It contains several non-linear components (various <i>floor</i> operations), which complicate reverse engineering as different skill levels can still produce the same combat level. The reported error margin in the combat formula (under 0.6%) can be explained by accidental typing errors in some of the skill level contributions used in the reverse engineering project.

== Usage ==
The main use for this template is for inclusion in a [[Special:Mypage|User page]] which contributors can create when they have opened an account on the wiki. 
Without an account please use the [[Runescape:Sandbox|Sandbox]] to experiment with the template, or post it on [[Special:Mypage|your page]] rather than editing this template page.

The general format for inserting the template is <tt>&#123;&#123; {{PAGENAME}} | ''combat parameters'' }} </tt>
The combat parameters follow the [[Template:User stats]] format. Note that when a parameter is absent, the template will use a default value of 1.

== Example ==
The following template call describes a new player without any combat experience. This also are the default values that the template uses when the parameter is absent or misspelled.
<pre>&#123;{Combat
|Attack=1
|Defence=1
|Strength=1
|Hitpoints=10
|Prayer=1
|Ranged=1
|Magic=1
|Summoning=1
}}</pre>
The template text above produces the following result:
{{Combat
|Attack=1 
|Defence=1
|Strength=1
|Hitpoints=10
|Prayer=1
|Ranged=1
|Magic=1
|Summoning=1
}} 
The table shows that a starting player will have a combat level of 3. Another example shows a slightly more advanced player:
<pre>&#123;{Combat|Attack=92|Defence=84
|Strength=91|Hitpoints=92|Prayer=73
|Ranged=87|Magic=98|Summoning=27}}</pre>
gives the following result:
{{Combat|Attack=75|Defence=75|Strength=75
|Hitpoints=75|Prayer=70|Ranged=70|Magic=82|Summoning=50}}
The first two rows in the table contain the skill levels for the skills that contribute to the the base combat. The base combat is shown with an accuracy of two decimal places. The following rows show the different combat classes (melee, ranged and magic). The row lists the combat skills used for a combat calculation as well as the fractional and the truncated combat values. For the example above, the in-game combat level shown for this player will be 115 which is the highest combat level in the table.

The highest combat levels can be achieved with the following skill levels:
{{Combat|Attack=99|Defence=99
|Strength=99|Hitpoints=99|Prayer=98
|Ranged=99|Magic=99|Summoning=98}}
So, no 99 prayer or 99 summoning is required for a combat level of 138, as the floor operation gives the same contribution to the base combat level.

== Possible uses ==
A simple use is to show the combat build up of a RuneScape character. A more advance use allows players to enter target combat skill levels and examine the effect on the combat level. This is particularly useful when training a pure. Pures may train other combat skills without impact their ''pureness''.
Some players are only interested in the levels they need to gain to achieve a certain combat level target. Computing the amount of experience points that such additional levels require can be easily derived from the experience difference between those levels.

== How it works ==
The gory details of the template are viewable by entering the ''edit'' mode for the template page. The [[Template:Combat_level|Combat level]] template performs the actual calculations. The template consumes around 24 KByte of pre-expand include space of the available 2 MByte.

Template:Ctr/doc:
==Documentation==
The '''ctr''' template is used align text and numbers within tables to the center of the cell.

===Examples===
<pre>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} | N/A
| {{ctr}} | Example of centred text.
|-
| {{ctr}} | Some centred text.
| {{ctr}} | etc.
|}
</pre>

yields:
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} | N/A
| {{ctr}} | Example of centred text.
|-
| {{ctr}} | Some centred text.
| {{ctr}} | etc.
|}

<pre>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} | N/A || {{ctr}} | Example of centred text.
|-
| {{ctr}} | Some centred text. || {{ctr}} | etc.
|}
</pre>

yields:
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} | N/A || {{ctr}} | Example of centred text.
|-
| {{ctr}} | Some centred text. || {{ctr}} | etc.
|}

===Combining with colspan===
To combine with colspan, place <nowiki>{{ctr}}</nowiki> first, followed by a space, then by colspan.

Example:
<pre>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} colspan=3 | Text over 3 columns
|-
| {{ctr}} | Column #1
| {{ctr}} | Column #2
| {{ctr}} | Column #3
|-
| {{ctr}} | A single column
| {{ctr}} colspan=2 | Text over two columns
|}
</pre>

will yield:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| {{ctr}} colspan=3 | Text over 3 columns
|-
| {{ctr}} | Column #1
| {{ctr}} | Column #2
| {{ctr}} | Column #3
|-
| {{ctr}} | A single column
| {{ctr}} colspan=2 | Text over two columns
|}

Remember, most browsers will render a header row as centered:
<pre>
{| class="wikitable"
! Header row
! Another header row
|-
| Standard row
| Another standard row
|}
</pre>

gives:
{| class="wikitable"
! Header row
! Another header row
|-
| Standard row
| Another standard row
|}

Template:DateDiff/doc:
==Documentation==
:''This template is only applicable for dates from 1 January 1970 onwards only.''

The '''DateDiff''' returns the difference in days (possibly with decimals) between two dates in the Gregorian calendar.  The return value is positive if <code>date2</code> comes ''after'' <code>date1</code>, and is negative if <code>date2</code> comes ''before'' <code>date1</code> (i.e. the template computes <code>date2 - date1</code>). 

===Usage===
If two dates supplied, the template calculates the difference between them, in days.  If only one date is supplied, then the supplied date is calculated against the current date.  If no dates are supplied, the template calculates the number of days from the start of the [[Wikipedia:Julian epoch|Julian epoch]] to the current date.  If an invalid date is supplied, then the text is returned unaltered.

The inputted dates may be in any format understood by the <code>#time:</code> parser function. (e.g. <code>July 18, 2008</code>, <code>18 July 2008</code> and <code>2008-07-18</code> are all valid.)  Hours, minutes and seconds can likewise be inputted.

This template can be used for dates from 1 January 1970 onwards only.

===Examples===
:{| class="wikitable"
! Code !! Output
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff|18 July 2008|2008-07-16}}</nowiki></code>
| {{DateDiff|18 July 2008|2008-07-16}}
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff|July 16, 2008 8PM|2008-07-18 8:00:00}}</nowiki></code>
| {{DateDiff|July 16, 2008 8PM|2008-07-18 8:00:00}}
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff|2008-07-18}}</nowiki></code>
| {{DateDiff|2008-07-18}}
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff|{{#time:c}}}}</nowiki></code>
| ''should always equal zero''
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff}}</nowiki></code>
| {{DateDiff}}
|-
| <code><nowiki>{{DateDiff|invalid}}</nowiki></code>
| {{DateDiff|invalid}}
|}

==See also==
* [[:Template:JulianDay]] - used in this template

Template:Dialogue/doc:
The template <code><nowiki>{{dialogue}}</nowiki></code> is used at the top of a page which provides a transcript of dialogue within ''RuneScape''.  It is used in conjunction with [[Template:hasdialogue]].

==Usage==
<pre>{{dialogue}}
{{dialogue|<link>}}</pre>

'''Parameters:'''
*'''link''' - Optional.  Used if the article for the subject whose dialogue this page represents is ''not'' located at the direct parent page to this page.

==Examples==
<pre>{{dialogue}}</pre> produces:
{{dialogue}}

<pre>{{dialogue|RuneScape:Yew Grove}}</pre> produces:
{{dialogue|RuneScape:Yew Grove}}

Template:DnDweek:
<includeonly>Week {{#expr:1+(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7))}}: {{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7}}days}} - {{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7)+6}}days}}</includeonly><noinclude>The '''DnDweek''' template ''automatically'' displays the current week for [[Distractions and Diversions]], and computes the start and end dates for the current week.  This eliminates the need to manually update the dates in the [[Distractions and Diversions Locations]] article.

==Preview==
* This template was modified on 2009-01-09 to deal with computational issues regarding leap years.
* For more information on ParserFunctions, see [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Help:ParserFunctions Help:ParserFunctions]

==Output==
Week {{#expr:1+(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7))}}: {{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7}}days}} - {{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7)+6}}days}}

==Formulae==
'''Week:''' 
<pre style="width:95%; overflow:scroll">{{#expr:1+(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7))}}</pre>
:gives '''{{#expr:1+(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7))}}'''.

'''Start of week:''' 
<pre style="width:95%; overflow:scroll">{{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7}}days}}</pre>
:gives '''{{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7}}days}}'''.

'''End of week:''' 
<pre style="width:95%; overflow:scroll">{{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7)+6}}days}}</pre>
:gives '''{{#time:j M Y|2008-08-27 + {{#expr:(trunc(trunc(({{#time:U}}-{{#time:U|2008-08-27}})/60/60/24)/7)*7)+6}}days}}'''.

===Additional notes===
* The chosen base date is 27 August 2008, rather than 2 September, as that it is what would have been the start of the first week. The calculations are easier with 27 August.

Template:Dst:
{{#switch: {{{1|us}}}

<!-- The template determines whether the current Unix timestamp is between the timestamps for the DST start and end dates. Returns a 1 if DST is currently being observed, 0 if not. -->

| uk = {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} < {{#time: U|1:00 {{#expr: 31 - {{#time: w|31 October}}}} October}} | {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} > {{#time: U|1:00 {{#expr: 31 - {{#time: w|31 March}}}} March}} | 1 | 0 }} | 0 }}

| us = {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} < {{#time: U|6:00 {{#expr: 7 - {{#time: w|7 November}}}} November}} | {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} > {{#time: U|7:00 {{#expr: 14 - {{#time: w|14 March}}}} March}} | 1 | 0 }} | 0 }}

<!-- Use reverse values for Australia as southern hemisphere -->
<!-- Note: Change is before GMT, so use 14:00 and -1 on day -->
| aus = {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} < {{#time: U|14:00 {{#expr: 7 - {{#time: w|7 October}} - 1}} October}} | {{#ifexpr: {{#time: U|{{{2|}}}}} > {{#time: U|14:00 {{#expr: 7 - {{#time: w|7 April}} - 1}} April}} | 0 | 1 }} | 1 }}

<!-- Add others here -->

| 0

}}<noinclude>

== Template documentation ==

This template determines whether [[wikipedia:daylight saving time|daylight saving time]] is currently in effect.

=== Syntax ===

<pre>
{{dst|rule|datetime}}
</pre>

=== Usage ===

This template determines whether daylight saving time is currently in effect. Since DST starts and ends at different times for different locations, three DST rules are supported: one for the US/Canada, one for Europe (which uses the same rule throughout), and one for Australia, excluding Tasmania (which is on a slightly different rule).

In North America and Australia, time switches between DST and standard at a certain local time, so this template may be a few hours early or late to update depending on your location. Time changes in all of Europe at 1:00 UTC, so this isn't an issue there.

Depending on the DST rule desired, "us", "uk", "aus" or "none" should be given as parameter to this template (defaults to "us").

By default, the DST given is for the current data and time. If the DST for a different datetime is desired, then this can be obtained by specifying the datetime string.</noinclude>

Template:ExchangeItem/doc:
<!-- There can be some additional doc templates here, but
     these are not (yet) supported on the RS wiki -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==
'''Template:ExchangeItem''' is used in Exchange:Item articles as part of the [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]].

===Usage===
For an example, see [[Exchange:Bones]].

===Adding new Exchange:Item articles===
To add a new Exchange item, create a new article "Exchange:Item_name" and copy the text below.

<pre>
{{ExchangeItem
|View={{{View}}}
|Icon= 
|Item=
|ItemId=
|Price=
|Last=
|Date=~~~~~
|LastDate=
|LowAlch=
|HighAlch=
|Store=
|Category=
}}
&lt;noinclude&gt;
*This template is used in [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]]
[[Category:Grand Exchange]]
&lt;/noinclude&gt;
</pre>

==="View" parameter===
This template is used to help build "lines" in the various lists of the [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]], and to help update prices on items lists.

The "View" parameter may be used to do the following:

*'''View=table''' - Displays a table row that is used for the Market Watch displays
*'''View=price''' - Displays just the price of the item when used elsewhere on this wiki
*'''View=HighAlch''' - Displays just the High Level Alchemy value of the item used elsewhere in this wiki
*'''View=diff''' - Returns the difference in price between the '''Last''' value and the '''Price''' value, if they have both been entered.
*'''View=itemid''' - Returns the id code used in the official [[Grand Exchange Database]]
*'''View=icon''' - Returns the icon of the item, as contained in the GEMW data

Template:ExtLink/doc:
====Purpose====

This is a "work around" template that is to help form external links inside templates or to fix what appears to be a bug with the MediaWiki software to create an external link when all of the data appears to be correct.

====Usage====

<nowiki>{{ExtLink|Link=http://itemdb-rs.runescape.com/viewitem.ws?obj={{:Exchange:Acorn|View=itemid}}|Text=Look up price}}</nowiki>

====Parameters====

*'''Link''' = a properly formed URL (Universal Resource Link-- usually a web page address) that links to some content of interest in the article
*'''Text''' (optional) = What text will substitute in the place of the URL when displayed within the Wiki markup

<includeonly>[[Category:Formatting templates]]</includeonly>
Template:Forumlink/doc:
Shows a link to a forum topic.

Example usage:
  <nowiki>{{</nowiki>{{BASEPAGENAME}}|f=5|t=100|See what people are talking about}}

Where 
*''f'' is the forum number (e.g. for Tavern, the number is 5)
*''t'' is the topic number
*The last parameter is the label for the link

Template:GEMW-add:
To ADD ITEM in the [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]]

1. Edit related Grand Exchange Market Watch/Skills page(s)

2. Add <pre>{{GEItem|ItemName}}</pre> to existing table

-or-

Start new table for new section on page

<pre>
{{GEHeader}}
{{GEItem|Bones}}
{{GEItem|ItemName}}
|}
</pre>

3. Click '''Save Page'''

4. If a red link Exchange:ItemName appears above table, then this is a first time entry:

<span style="color:red">Exchange:ItemName</span>
{{GEHeader}}
|}

5. Click on red link to create and edit new article Exchange:ItemName.

[[Category:Grand Exchange]]

6. In Edit mode go down below the edit window, set '''Insert template: (click to browse)''' to  'ExchangeItemNameText'  which will insert the below text into the new article Exchange:ItemName.

<pre>
{{ExchangeItem
|View={{{View}}} <!-- Do not change -->
|Icon=  <!-- Image file name, without 'Image:' -->
|Item=  <!-- Item name -->
|ItemId= <!-- Item Id number on the Jagex GE database -->
|Price=  <!-- Current GE (average) price. Use no commas. -->
|Last=  <!--  Old price  -->
|Date=   <!-- Add five tildes (~~~~~) to add current time/date -->
|LastDate=  <!--  Old date  -->
|LowAlch= 
|HighAlch= 
|Store=  <!-- Store (infinite stock) price -->
|Category=  <!-- Market Watch item category... to help sort thing on full list -->
}}
<noinclude>
*This template is used in [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]] <!-- Add "/SkillName" behind the word Watch   -->
[[Category:Grand Exchange]]
</noinclude>
</pre>

:([[Template:ExchangeItemNameText]]. Source: [[Template:ExchangeItem]])

7. Add '''ItemName''' to parameter ''Item'' =  (Most important step, use correct ItemName)

8. Add other data available and '''Save Page'''

Template:Goal/doc:
<!-- There can be some additional doc templates here, but
     these are not (yet) supported on the RS wiki -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
= Template Documentation =

The '''Goal''' template displays a skill goal level and compares it with the current level and shows a completion bar based on the amount of experience points. It copies the functionality provided by other fan-sites and which some users have included into their user page. For non-skill goals, see [[Template:SimpleGoal]].

==Usage==
<pre>
{{Goal
  |Skill     = name of skill
  |Label     = optional label (replaces skill image)
  |Goal      = target level
  |Level     = current level
  |Xp        = current experience points (alternative to Level)
  |BarColor1 = color of achieved part of progress bar (default green)
  |BarColor2 = color of remaining part of progress bar (default blue)
}}
</pre>
The current status of the skill can either be specified by the 'Level' input parameter or by the 'Xp' input parameter.

Please note that using the template requires 29KByte of pre-include space, which has a maximum of 2Megabyte. So, this gives a maximum of around 65 goal templates on a single user page when no other templates are being used. The generated html typically is only 1k Bytes.

<pre>&#123;{Goal | Skill=Mining | Goal=85 | Level=72 }}</pre>
The code yields the following result:
{{Goal | Skill=Mining | Goal=85 | Level=72 }}
From left to the right:
- The skill / desired icon (see below)
- (green bar) The accessed level
- (blue bar) The goal level
- Completion percentage
- Levels left to achieve the goal
- Xp left to achieve the goal

==Examples==
Below are some examples of the various uses of the Goal template. The first example defines the current skill status using the ''Level'' parameter:
<pre>&#123;{Goal | Skill=Mining | Goal=85 | Level=72 }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{Goal | Skill=Mining | Goal=85 | Level=72 }}


The second example defines the actual skill status by using the ''Xp'' parameter.
<pre>&#123;{Goal | Skill=Attack | Goal=85 | Xp=900000 }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{Goal|Skill=Attack|Goal=85|Xp=900000}}


The third example also uses the ''Xp'' input value, which just happens to be higher than the value given in the ''Goal''.
<pre>&#123;{Goal | Skill=Crafting | Goal=85 | Xp=3527150 }}</pre>
This produces the following result:
{{Goal | Skill=Crafting | Goal=85 | Xp=3527150 }}


The forth example shows how the ''Label'' can be used instead of the default ''Skill'' image. It also shows how different colors can be specified for the progress bar.
<pre>&#123;{Goal | Skill=Crafting | Goal=85 | Xp=900000
  | Label='''my label''' | BarColor1=darkcyan | BarColor2=red }}</pre>
This produces the following result:
{{Goal | Skill=Crafting | Goal=85 | Xp=900000 | Label='''my label'''  | BarColor1=darkcyan | BarColor2=red }}

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

Template:Goal:
<includeonly>
{| cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border: 1px solid #E0E0E0;width:441px;background-color:transparent" 
<!-- Start with the goal template code to generate a
     wiki style table. -->
<!--
    First cell has a skill icon that clicks to the skill
-->
| style="width:25px; border:0px;" | {{{Label|{{Skill clickpic|{{{Skill|Skills}}}}}}}} 
<!--
    The second cell contains yet another table. 
-->
| style="border:0px;" |
{| style="width:201px; text-align:right; border:0px; color:white" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" 
| style="border:0px; padding:0px; width:{{#expr:({{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}}/{{XP|{{{Goal}}}}}round2)*200+1}}px" bgcolor="{{{BarColor1|green}}}" | {{{Level|{{XP to Level|{{{Xp|0}}}}}}}}
| style="border:0px; padding:0px;" bgcolor="{{{BarColor2|blue}}}" | {{ #ifexpr: {{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}} < {{XP|{{{Goal}}}}} | {{{Goal}}} }}
|}
<!--
    The third cell contains the percentage done
-->
| style="width:25px; text-align:center; border:0px;" | {{#ifexpr: {{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}} < {{XP|{{{Goal}}}}} | {{#expr:trunc({{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}}/{{XP|{{{Goal}}}}}*100)}}% | 100% }}
<!--
    The fourth cell contains the level to go.
-->
| style="width:20px; text-align:center; border:0px;" | {{#expr:{{{Goal|{{XP to Level|{{{Xp|0}}}}}}}}-{{{Level|{{XP to Level|{{{Xp|0}}}}}}}}}}
<!--
    The fifth cell contains the XP to go, or 'Achieved'
-->
| style="width:100px; text-align:center; border:0px;" | {{#ifexpr: {{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}} < {{XP|{{{Goal}}}}} | {{formatnum:{{#expr:{{XP|{{{Goal}}}}}-{{{Xp|{{XP|{{{Level}}}}}}}}}}}} xp | '''Achieved''' }}
|} </includeonly> <noinclude>
{{{{FULLPAGENAME}}/doc}}

</noinclude>

Template:Hs:
<noinclude>{{permprot}}</noinclude><span class="plainlinks">[http://hiscore.runescape.com/hiscorepersonal.ws?user1={{urlencode:{{{1}}}}} {{{2|{{{1}}}}}}]</span><noinclude>

== Usage ==

Provides a link to the hiscore page for a ''RuneScape'' user.

=== Syntax ===

<pre>
{{hs|name|caption}}
</pre>

* '''name''': The name of the ''RuneScape'' user that the template should link to.
* '''caption''' (optional): A caption for the link. In other words, the text that forms the link. Defaults to the user name.</noinclude>

Template:Infobar Summon Pouch/doc:
== Template Documentation ==  <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

The '''Infobar Summon Pouch''' template is used to show the details of the Summoning pouch.

== Usage ==
<pre>{{Infobar Summon Pouch
| name       = pouch name
| image      = image location
| shards     = number of Spirit shards
| charm      = charm type (gold, blue, green, crimson)
| tertiary   = tertiary component
| createxp   = experience for creating
| usexp      = experience for using
| high       = high level alchemy  (Do NOT use commas. It is added automatically.)
| low        = low level alchemy  (Do NOT use commas. It is added automatically.)
| exchange   = gemw   <!-- DO NOT CHANGE THIS PARAMETER -->
}}</pre>

== Example ==
The following is an example:
<pre>{{Infobar Summon Pouch
| name       = Steel titan pouch
| image      = [[Image:Steel_titan_pouch.gif]]
| shards     = 178
| charm      = [[Crimson charm|Crimson]]
| tertiary   = [[Steel platebody]]
| createxp   = 435.2
| usexp      = 8.6
| high       = 2924
| low        = 1949
| exchange   = gemw 
}}</pre>

Produces the following result: 
{{Infobar Summon Pouch
| name       = Steel titan pouch

Template:Infobar Summon Scroll/doc:
== Template Documentation ==  <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

The '''Infobar Summon Scroll''' template is used to show the details of the Summoning scroll.

== Usage ==
<pre>{{Infobar Summon Scroll
| name       = scroll name
| image      = image location
| createxp   = experience for creating
| usexp      = experience for using
| special    = special move points
| high       = high level alchemy
| low        = low level alchemy
| exchange   = gemw   <!-- DO NOT CHANGE THIS PARAMETER -->
}}</pre>

== Example ==
The following is an example:
<pre>{{Infobar Summon Scroll
| name       = Howl scroll
| image      = [[Image:HowlScroll.png]]
| createxp   = 0.1
| usexp      = 0.1
| special    = 3
| high       = 35
| low        = 23
| exchange   = gemw 
}}</pre>

Produces the following result: 
{{Infobar Summon Scroll
| name       = Howl scroll
| image      = [[Image:HowlScroll.png]]
| createxp   = 0.1
| usexp      = 0.1
| special    = 3
| high       = 35
| low        = 23
| exchange   = gemw 
}}

==See also==
* [[Template:Infobar Summon Pouch]]

==Documentation==
===Usage===
<pre>{{Infobox City
| name       = The city's real name, not a short form. (eg. Varrock-Dukea Avarrocka)
| map        = A map of the city, without picture tags (eg ''Example.jpg'', not ''[[Image:Example.jpg]]''.
| AKA        = What the city is commonly called by others. (eg. Falador-Fally)
| kingdom    = Which kingdom or region the city is contained. (eg. Relekka-Fremenik Lands)
| members    = If the city is in a members-only area, Yes or No.
| bank       = If the city has a bank or not, If so number of banks.
| altar      = If the city has an altar or not, If so, number them.
| obelisks   = If the city has a small obelisk or not, If so, number them.
| music      = A music tune from a main, central area of the city. (eg. Mort'ton-Shadowland)
| leader     = The leader or king of the city. (eg. East Arougne-King Lathas)
| tele       = A teleportation spell from a spellbook or jewelry. (eg. Edgeville-Amulet of Glory)
| guild      = A guild in or near the city.
| race       = The race or inhabitants of the city. (eg. Falador-White Knights, Canifis-Werewolves)
}}</pre>

===Example===
<pre>{{Infobox City
| name       = Dukea Avarrocka
| map        = East ardougne.PNG
| AKA        = Falador
| kingdom    = Kharidian Desert
| members    = No
| bank       = 48
| alter      = 11
| obelisks   = 27
| music      = Lateralus
| leader     = Osama Bin-laden
| tele       = Ring of Terrorism, Teleport to Draynor Village
| guild      = No
| race       = Humans, Dwarves
}}</pre>

{{Infobox City

| members    = Yes

| altar      = 1
| obelisks   = 0
| music      = Baroque
| leader     = [[King Lathas]]
| tele       = Yes
| guild      = No
| race       = Humans
}}

==Usage==
 <nowiki>{{Infobox Dungeon
| name    = The name of the dungeon, e.g. Varrock Sewers.

| music   = the main music tune of the dungeon, e.g. "starlight" of Asgarnian Ice Dungeon.
| level   = How many levels the dungeon has, e.g. most dungeons have one.
| monster = the strongest monster in the dungeon, e.g. the Ancient Caverns' one is the mithril dragon.
| quests  = Any quests involved or started in the dungeon? e.g. Heroes Quest is involved with the White Wolf Mountain Caves.
| race    = What races lie in the dungeon? e.g. Ogres, demons and dragons of the Ogre Enclave.
}}</nowiki>

Template:Infobox Seed/doc:
{{clear}}

==Usage==
{| style="background: transparent;"
<pre>{{Infobox Seed
| name       = The item's real name, not a short form.
| AKA        = What the item is commonly called by others.
| image      = An image of the item.
| level      = Level required to grow.
| patch      = Patch for growing this seed.
| time       = Time taken to finish growing (in minutes).
| plant      = Experience for planting seed.
| check      = Experience for checking.
| harvest    = Experience for harvesting each result.
| quest      = If the item is a quest item, Yes or No.
| tradable   = If the item is tradable, Yes or No.
| stackable  = If the item is stackable, Yes or No.
| high       = Coins you get from high-alcing the item.  If not applicable: No
| low        = Coins you get from low-alching the item.  If not applicable: No
| destroy    = Text when you are trying to destroy the item.  If not destructible: Drop
| store      = The prices the general/speciality store sells the item for when its stock is full.
| currency   = If the currency used is other than coins, state the currency.
| seller     = Store/NPC having a stock of the item.
| exchange   = The item's price at the Grand Exchange.
| examine    = What the item says when examined.
| weight     = The item's weight.
}}</pre>
|}

==Details==

===name===
The name of the item '''exactly''' as it appears in game (identical case, spaces, typo, etc).  If the pagename matches '''exactly''', this field may be omitted.

===AKA===
Also known as: other name(s) commonly used by players to refer to the item.  If omitted, the field will be '''hidden'''.

===image===
An image of the item, with the "Image:" tag.  Preferentially in [[Wikipedia:Portable_Network_Graphics|PNG]] format (or [[Wikipedia:GIF|GIF]] format if the image is animated). 

'''Example:'''
* <nowiki>[[Image:</nowiki>''Example.jpg''<nowiki>]]</nowiki>

===members===
Whether the item is accessible only to [[Pay-to-play|members]] (e.g. displayed as "Members object" in free-to-play worlds). 

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes
* No

===level===
The level required to plant the seed.

'''Example:'''
*<tt>5</tt>
*<tt>10</tt>
*<tt>60</tt>

===patch===
The patch in which the seed grows in. '''Do not''' include "patch" after the entry, it will be added automatically.

'''Example:'''
*<tt>Allotment</tt> would be displayed as [[Allotment patch]]

===time===
The time it takes to grow the seed from the point of planting to the point that it is fully grown, please write the time in minutes.

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>35</tt>
*<tt>100</tt>

===plant===
The experience gained by planting the seed. For seeds which give more than 999 experience, comma should be used as a thousands separator, per the [[RuneScape:Style_guide#Numbers|Style guide]]

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>30</tt>
*<tt>1,500</tt>

===check===
The experience gained for using the "Check health" option. This XP bonus is only available to bush, fruit trees, wood trees, and some special trees, for other plants, please place N/A in this field. As stated above, if the experience gained exceeds 999, use a comma as a thousands separator, per the Style guide.

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>500</tt>
*<tt>1,500</tt>
*<tt>N/A</tt>

===harvest===
The experience gained from harvesting the plant. Please note that wood trees and spirit trees '''do not''' give harvesting experience, for these plants, please place N/A in this field. As stated above, if the experience gained exceeds 999, use a comma as a thousands separator, per the Style guide.

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>500</tt>
*<tt>1,500</tt>
*<tt>N/A</tt>

===quest===
See [[Quest items]].  Also applicable for [[miniquest]]s.

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes - <nowiki>[[</nowiki>''Quest name''<nowiki>]]</nowiki>
* No

===tradable===
'''Leave this out unless the item is not tradeable.''' If the item is not [[tradable]] between players, or in the [[Grand Exchange]] then set this to ''No''.

'''Examples:'''
*No

===stackable===
Whether the item stacks in the player's inventory. 

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes
* No

===high===
Coins obtained after casting the [[High Level Alchemy]] spell on the item.  Values larger than 999 coins should have '''commas''' as per the [[RS:SG|Style guide]], and the ''RuneScape'' currency "coins", "gp", etc. need not be added to the field, as it is added automatically.

If the High Level Alchemy cannot be cast on the item, the field should be set to "No".

'''Examples:'''
* 2,200
* 500
* No

===low===
Coins obtained after casting the [[Low Level Alchemy]] spell on the item.   Values larger than 999 coins should have '''commas''' as per the [[RS:SG|Style guide]], and the ''RuneScape'' currency "coins", "gp", etc. need not be added to the field, as it is added automatically.

If the Low Level Alchemy cannot be cast on the item, the field should be set to "No".  Usually, the coins obtained is roughly 2/3<sup>rd</sup> the coins obtained using High Level Alchemy.

'''Examples:'''
* 1,100
* 500
* No

===destroy===
Text displayed as a final warning when a player tries to [[destroy]] the item.  Destroy is an option for some items from [[quests]] or [[Discontinued items and holiday drops]].  If there is no "Destroy" option, the value for the field is "Drop", as most items have the "Drop" option.  Certain items may behave differently when it is dropped, and this behaviour should be included in the field with " - " as a separator.  For example, an [[Explosive potion]] explodes when dropped.

'''Examples:'''
* ''The Oneiromancer might be able to help you get another.'' - [[Lunar staff]]
* Drop
* Drop - Explodes

===store===
Price at which the seed is '''sold by''' a shop (or NPC) which has an "Infinite stock" of the item.

The coins obtained when the item is sold at the store should NOT be entered. Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the Style guide, and the ''RuneScape'' currency ("coins", "gp", etc.) need not be added to the field, as it is added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>20</tt>
*<tt>20,000</tt>
*<tt>N/A</tt>

===currency===
If the store uses a [[currency]] '''other than''' coins, this field should be added specifying the currency used to purchase the item.  If possible, a link should be added to the currency article.

'''Examples:'''
*[[Pieces of Eight]]
*[[Tokkul]]

===seller===
The store (or a NPC) '''where''' the item is sold.  Only the '''name''' need to be entered, as the link to the article will be added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
* Daga's Scimitar Smithy
* Culinaromancer's Chest

===exchange===
Average price of the item in the [[Grand Exchange]].  This is the default Grand Exchange price, i.e. the '''average''' price set by the game when selling or buying the item.  

If the item has a [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]] page, set this field to "gemw" (or ''<nowiki>{{GEPrice|Item name}}</nowiki>'') to automatically add the Grand Exchange price. If the item is not tradable, this field will be hidden (not shown), and the field may be removed or left blank.  

'''Examples:'''
* 12,000 - used for first 'exchange=' entry and/or if no GEMW page is available.  Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the [[RS:SG#Numbers|Style guide]].
* gemw - adds the "update" link for updating the Exchange price.  Do not use "gemw" if the article pagename is different from the "GEPrice" item name.
* <nowiki>{{GEPrice|</nowiki>''Item name''<nowiki>}}</nowiki> - no "update" link provided; used only if "GEMW" item name is different from article pagename.

===examine===
The exact text (identical case, spaces, typo, etc) given when the player examines the fully grown plant.

'''Examples:'''
*<tt>A potato seed - plant in an allotment.</tt>
*<tt>Plant this in a plantpot of soil to grow a sapling.</tt>

===weight===
The item's weight.  The weight appears in the [[Equipment Stats]] submenu from [[Worn Equipment]] [[interface]].  The weight unit ("kilogram", "kg") need NOT be added to this field, as it is added automatically.  For special weight-reducing items which has "negative" weight, the negative "-" should be included in the field.

'''Examples:'''
* 2
* -4.5

==Example==
<pre>{{Infobox Seed
| name       = Potato seed
| AKA        = 
| image      = [[Image:Potato_seed.PNG]]
| members    = 
| level      = 1
| patch      = Allotment
| time       = 35
| plant      = 8
| check      = N/A
| harvest    = 9
| quest      = 
| tradable   = 
| stackable  = 
| high       = 
| low        = 
| destroy    = 
| store      = 1
| currency   = 
| seller     = 
| exchange   = {{GEPrice|Potato seed}}
| examine    = A potato seed - plant in an allotment.
| weight     = 
}}</pre>

{{Infobox Seed
| name       = Potato seed
| AKA        = 
| image      = [[Image:Potato_seed.PNG]]
| members    = 
| level      = 1

| check      = N/A
| harvest    = 9
| quest      =

| low        =

Template:Infobox Monster/doc:
{{clear}}
==Documentation==

===Updates===
* Template recently modified 26 January 2008 - '''slay''' changed to '''slaylvl''', '''exp''' deleted; '''max hit''' is new for some of the older articles.''
* Template recently modified 24 April 2008 - '''slayxp''' added since the Slayer XP received from a monster is not always equal to its HP.
* Template recently modified - '''other drops''' removed since it is better explained within the article.

===Usage===
<pre>
{{Infobox Monster
|name             = Name of the monster.
|image            = Image of the monster.
|level            = The monster's level.
|HP               = The monster's hitpoints.
|slaylvl          = Slayer level required to be able to kill the monster.
|slayxp           = Slayer XP received from killing the monster on a slayer task. NOT always equal to HP!
|members          = Is the monster members only? Yes or No.
|aggressive       = Is the monster aggressive? Yes or No.
|poisonous        = Can the monster poison players? If yes, enter the poison's max hit.
|immune to poison = Does the monster have immunity to poison? Yes or No.
|attack style     = Melee, Ranged, Magic, or any combination of these.
|max hit          = The monster's maximum hit. Mention multiple attack styles.
|weakness         = What is the monster weakness(es)?
|always drops     = What the monster always drops.
|examine          = Examine text.
}}
</pre>

===Parameters details===

====image====
An image of the monster, with the image tag. Preferentially in PNG (or gif if animated). Example :
* ''<nowiki>[[Image:Example.jpg]]</nowiki>''

====level====
The monster's combat level.

====HP====
The monster's [[hitpoints]]. Beware that when fighting a monster, if the fight isn't short enough the monster will regenerate some HP. So this information is best gathered using [[Monster Examine]] or during a quick fight.

====slaylvl====
The [[Slayer level]] required to be able to kill the monster as a slayer assignment. 

If the monster is a Slayer monster, set to Slayer level ''number''.
* ''5'' returns ''Level 5''

If the monster is not a Slayer monster '''but can be''' a slayer assignment, set this to "1" which will return "Level 1" which is the minimum slayer level for all players. 
* ''1'' returns ''Level 1''

If the monster is '''not''' a slayer assignment, set this to "no" which will return "Not assigned". 
* ''no'' returns ''Not assigned''

====slayxp====
The Slayer XP received from killing the monster on a slayer assignment. This is NOT always equal to the monster's hitpoints, and also can be a decimal, so please check your Slayer XP before submitting! Then kill 10, then subtract your old XP from your current XP and divide by 10.

====attack style====
Which attack styles can the monster use?  Examples:
* ''Melee''
* ''Ranged''
* ''Magic''
* ''Ranged and melee''

====max hit====
The monster's maximum hit, for every attack style if applicable. Examples :
* ''18''
* ''18 (Melee), 21(Ranged)''

====weakness====
The monster's weakness, which is what type of attack or spell it's less defended from. Examples:
*''[[Crush]]''
*''Ranged''
*''Magic''
*''[[Slash]], Ranged''
*''Fire spells''

Note that equipment to protect you from monsters' attacks (such as an [[Anti-dragon shield]] against a dragon) is NOT considered a weakness. Items to successfully kill or attack a monster (such as [[Ice cooler]]s on a [[Desert lizard]]) is NOT considered a weakness either.

====members====
Whether or not the monster is accessible only to [[Pay-to-play|members]]. The only possible values for this field are :
* ''Yes''
* ''No''

====aggressive====
Whether or not the monster is [[Aggressiveness|aggressive]]. The only possible values for this field are :
* ''Yes''
* ''No''

====poisonous====
Whether or not the monster is [[Poison|poisonous]]. If yes, enter the poison's max hit. Examples :
* ''No''
* ''6''

====immune to poison====
Whether or not the monster is unaffected by [[poison]]. The only possible values for this field are :
* ''Yes''
* ''No''

====examine====
The examine text (obtained through the contextual menu ''Examine'' option), '''exactly''' as it appears in game (identical case, typo, etc).

===Removed parameters===
The following parameters have been removed, but they can still be found in a lot of articles, so they are still in the documentation for information purpose only.

====exp====
Combat [[experience]] gained by killing the monster. This parameter was removed because it can be easily calculated from the monster's HP : for every 1 HP damage dealt, the player gains 1.33 hitpoints XP and 4 (or 2) combat XP (shared between combat skills depending on the [[Attack Style]]).

====other drops====
The most notable items that this monster drops. This parameter was removed as drop lists are mentioned on the monster's page in better detail. 

===Example===
<pre>
{{Infobox Monster
|name              = Rune ring
|image             = [[Image:Example.jpg]]
|level             = 999
|HP                = 999
|slaylvl           = 1
|slayxp            = 999.8
|attack style      = Melee, magic, ranged
|max hit           = 48 (mage), 35 (melee), 27 (ranged)
|weakness          = [[Stab]]
|members           = No
|aggressive        = Yes
|poisonous         = 11
|immune to poison  = Yes
|always drops      = 50 or 450 [[pure essence]] (noted)
|examine           = Quite an unusual foe.
}}
</pre>

{{Infobox Monster
|name              = Rune ring
|image             = [[Image:Example.jpg]]
|level             = 999
|HP                = 999
|slaylvl           = 1
|slayxp            = 999.8
|attack style      = Melee, magic, ranged
|max hit           = 48 (mage), 35 (melee), 27 (ranged)
|weakness          = [[Stab]]
|members           = No
|aggressive        = Yes
|poisonous         = 11
|immune to poison  = Yes
|always drops      = 50 or 450 [[pure essence]] (noted)
|examine           = Quite an unusual foe.
}}

Template:Infobox Set/doc:
{{clear}}
==Usage==
{| style="background: transparent;"
<pre>{{Infobox Set
| name       = The set's real name, not a short form.
| AKA        = What the set is commonly called by others.
| image      = Images of the items in the set.
| members    = If the set is members, Yes or No.
| quest      = If the set pieces are quest items, Yes or No.
| tradable   = If the set is tradable, Yes or No.
| equipable  = If the set is equipable, Yes or No.
| stackable  = If the set is stackable, Yes or No.
| store      = The prices the general/speciality store sells the set for when its stock is full.
| currency   = If the currency used is other than coins, state the currency.
| seller     = Store/NPC having a stock of the set.
| exchange   = The set's price at the Grand Exchange.
}}</pre>
|}

==Details==
===name===
The name of the set '''exactly''' as it appears in game (identical case, spaces, typo, etc).  If the pagename matches '''exactly''', this field may be omitted.

===AKA===
Also known as: other name(s) commonly used by players to refer to the set.  If omitted, the field will be '''hidden'''.

===image===
Images of the items in the set, with the "Image:" tag.  Preferentially in [[Wikipedia:Portable_Network_Graphics|PNG]] format (or [[Wikipedia:GIF|GIF]] format if the image is animated). 

'''Example:'''
* <nowiki>[[Image:</nowiki>''Example.jpg''<nowiki>]]</nowiki>

===members===
Whether the set is accessible only to [[Pay-to-play|members]] (e.g. displayed as "Members objects" in free-to-play worlds). 

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes
* No

===quest===
See [[Quest items]].  Also applicable for [[miniquest]]s.

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes - <nowiki>[[</nowiki>''Quest name''<nowiki>]]</nowiki>
* No

===tradable===
Whether the set is [[tradable]] between players, or in the [[Grand Exchange]]. For example, [[Barrows gloves]] are bought from a "shop" ([[Culinaromancer's Chest]]), but these gloves cannot be sold to other players as the Barrows gloves are not tradable. 

If cases when the set is only tradeable in certain situations, further details may be added to the values above, using the " - " as a separator. For example, the [[Barrows equipment]] can only be traded when it is completely degraded or fully repaired.

'''Examples:'''
* Yes
* No
* Yes - only when uncharged

===equipable===
Whether the set is equipable.  For instance, a [[Rune sword]] may be wielded (Yes), while a tinderbox may not be equipped (No). 

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes
* No

===store===
Price at which the set is '''sold by''' a shop (or a NPC) which has an "Infinite stock" of the set.  Some shops, like the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]], do not have an infinite stock.  Thus, the price entered should be the price when the "Main Stock" (NOT Player Stock) has '''full stock'''.  If the item cannot be bought from an NPC, set this field to "No". 

The coins obtained when the item is sold at the store should NOT be entered.  Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the [[RS:SG|Style guide]], and the ''RuneScape'' currency ("coins", "gp", etc.) need not be added to the field, as it is added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
* 15,000
* 18
* No

===currency===
If the store uses a [[currency]] '''other than''' coins, this field should be added specifying the currency used to purchase the item.  If possible, a link should be added to the currency article.

'''Examples:'''
*[[Pieces of Eight]]
*[[Tokkul]]

===seller===
The store (or a NPC) '''where''' the set is sold.  Only the '''name''' need to be entered, as the link to the article will be added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
* Daga's Scimitar Smithy
* Culinaromancer's Chest

===exchange===
Average price of the item in the [[Grand Exchange]].  This is the default Grand Exchange price, i.e. the '''average''' price set by the game when selling or buying the item.  

If the item has a [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]] page, set this field to "gemw" (or ''<nowiki>{{GEPrice|Item name}}</nowiki>'') to automatically add the Grand Exchange price. If the item is not tradable, this field will be hidden (not shown), and the field may be removed or left blank.  

'''Examples:'''
* 12,000 - used for first 'exchange=' entry and/or if no GEMW page is available.  Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the [[RS:SG#Numbers|Style guide]].
* gemw - adds the "update" link for updating the Exchange price.  Do not use "gemw" if the article pagename is different from the "GEPrice" item name.
* <nowiki>{{GEPrice|</nowiki>''Item name''<nowiki>}}</nowiki> - no "update" link provided; used only if "GEMW" item name is different from article pagename.


==Example==
{| style="float: left; background: transparent;"
<pre>{{Infobox Set
| image      = [[Image:Statius Helm small.gif]][[Image:Statius Body small.gif]][[Image:Statius Legs small.gif]][[Image:Statius Warhammer small.gif]]
| members    = Yes
| quest      = No
| tradable   = Yes
| equipable  = Yes
| destroy    = Drop
| store      = No
| exchange   = {{formatnum:{{#expr:({{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's full helm|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's platebody|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's platelegs|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's warhammer|View=price}})}}}}
}}</pre>
|}

{{Infobox Set
| image      = [[Image:Statius Helm small.gif]][[Image:Statius Body small.gif]][[Image:Statius Legs small.gif]][[Image:Statius Warhammer small.gif]]
| members    = Yes
| quest      = No
| tradable   = Yes
| equipable  = Yes
| destroy    = Drop
| store      = No
| exchange   = {{formatnum:{{#expr:({{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's full helm|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's platebody|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's platelegs|View=price}}+ {{:Exchange:Corrupt statius's warhammer|View=price}})}}}}
}}

===tradable===
Whether the item is [[tradable]] between players, or in the [[Grand Exchange]]. For example, [[Gloves (barrows)|Barrows gloves]] are bought from a "shop" ([[Culinaromancer's Chest]]), but these gloves cannot be sold to other players as the Barrows gloves are not tradable.

'''Examples:'''

===equipable===
Whether the item is equipable. For instance, a [[Rune sword]] may be wielded (Yes), while a tinderbox may not be equipped (No).

* Yes
* No

===edible===
Whether the item is edible. If omitted, the field will be '''hidden'''.

===stackable===
Whether the item stacks in the player's inventory, in its unnoted form. For example, [[runes]] and [[arrows]] are [[stackable]], while [[pickaxes]] are not. 

The possible values for this field are:
* Yes
* No

===high===

If the High Level Alchemy cannot be cast on the item, the field should be set to "No".

'''Examples:'''

===low===

If the Low Level Alchemy cannot be cast on the item, the field should be set to "No". Usually, the coins obtained is roughly 2/3<sup>rd</sup> the coins obtained using High Level Alchemy.

'''Examples:'''
* 1,100

===destroy===

If there is no "Destroy" option, the value for the field is "Drop", as most items have the "Drop" option.  Certain items may behave differently when it is dropped, and this behaviour should be included in the field with " - " as a separator.  For example, an [[Explosive potion]] explodes when dropped.

'''Examples:'''
* ''The Oneiromancer might be able to help you get another.'' - [[Lunar staff]]
* Drop
* Drop - Explodes

===store===
Price at which the item is '''sold by''' a shop (or a NPC) which has an "Infinite stock" of the item. Some shops, like the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]], do not have an infinite stock.  Thus, the price entered should be the price when the "Main Stock" (NOT Player Stock) has '''full stock'''. If the item cannot be bought from an NPC, set this field to "No". 

The coins obtained when the item is sold at the store should NOT be entered. Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the [[RS:SG|Style guide]], and the ''RuneScape'' currency ("coins", "gp", etc.) need not be added to the field, as it is added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
* 15,000
* 18
* No

===currency===
If the store uses a [[currency]] '''other than''' coins, this field should be added specifying the currency used to purchase the item.  If possible, a link should be added to the currency article.

'''Examples:'''
*[[Pieces of Eight]]
*[[Tokkul]]

===seller===
The store (or a NPC) '''where''' the item is sold.  Only the '''name''' need to be entered, as the link to the article will be added automatically.

'''Examples:'''
* Daga's Scimitar Smithy
* Culinaromancer's Chest

===exchange===
Average price of the item in the [[Grand Exchange]]. This is the default Grand Exchange price, i.e. the '''average''' price set by the game when selling or buying the item.  

If the item has a [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]] page, set this field to "gemw" (or ''<nowiki>{{GEPrice|Item name}}</nowiki>'') to automatically add the Grand Exchange price. If the item is not tradable, this field will be hidden (not shown), and the field may be removed or left blank.  

'''Examples:'''
* 12,000 - used for first 'exchange=' entry and/or if no GEMW page is available. Values larger than 999 coins should have commas as per the [[RS:SG#Numbers|Style guide]].
* gemw - adds the "update" link for updating the Exchange price. Do not use "gemw" if the article pagename is different from the "GEPrice" item name.
* <nowiki>{{GEPrice|</nowiki>''Item name''<nowiki>}}</nowiki> - no "update" link provided; used only if "GEMW" item name is different from article pagename.

===examine===
The [[examine]] text '''exactly''' as it appears in game (identical case, spaces, typo, etc). The text is obtained through the contextual menu "Examine" option.

===weight===
The item's weight. The weight appears in the [[Equipment Stats]] submenu from [[Worn Equipment]] [[interface]]. The weight unit ("kilogram", "kg") need NOT be added to this field, as it is added automatically.  For special weight-reducing items which has "negative" weight, the negative "-" should be included in the field.

'''Examples:'''
* 2
* -4.5

==Example==
{| style="float: left; background: transparent;"
<pre>{{Infobox Item
| name       = Dragon scimitar
| image      = [[Image:Dragon scimitar.png]]
| AKA        = D scim, D scimmy, Drag scimitar, Drag scimmy, Dragon skimmy
| members    = Yes
| quest      = Yes - [[Monkey Madness]]
| tradable   = Yes
| equipable  = Yes
| edible     = 
| stackable  = No
| high       = 60,000
| low        = 40,000
| destroy    = Drop
| store      = 100,000
| seller     = Daga's Scimitar Smithy
| exchange   = {{GEPrice|Dragon scimitar}}
| examine    = A vicious, curved sword.
| weight     = 2
}}</pre>
|}

Template:Infobox familiar/doc:
==Template Documentation==
The '''Infobox familiar''' template describes the Summoning familiar. 
{{clear}}

==Usage==
<pre>
{{Infobox familiar
|name          = <!-- Name of the familiar. -->
|image         = <!-- Image of the familiar. -->
|level         = <!-- Level required to summon. -->
|time          = <!-- Time for familiar stays out before needing to be renewed. In minutes-->
|points        = <!-- Summoning points used. -->
|ability       = <!-- What ability does the familiar grant the player (e.g. Macaw grants Remote View) -->
|special       = <!-- What is the familiars scroll special? -->
|race          = <!-- What race/species is the familiar? -->
|combat        = <!-- The familiars combat level. -->
|hitpoints     = <!-- The familiars hitpoints. -->
|immune to posion = <!-- Whether the familiar is immune to poison. -->
|style         = <!-- What style of attack does the familiar use? --!>
|max           = <!-- What is the familiars max hit? -->
|examine       = <!-- The examine text of the familiar. -->
}}
</pre>

==Example==
<pre>
{{Infobox familiar
|name          = Steel titan
|image         = [[Image:Steel_titanz.PNG|Steel titan]]
|level         = 99
|time          = 64
|points        = 10
|ability       = Defence boost (15% bonus to your stab, slash and crush Defence) - invisible
|special       = Steel of Legends
|combat        = 230
|hitpoints     = 754
|immune to poison = Yes
|style         = Ranged
|max           = 24
|race          = [[Titan]]
|examine       = The king of the titans!
}}
</pre>

Simply put '''<nowiki>{{inuse}}</nowiki>''' at the top of an article before proceeding with a major edit, and remove the template when the editing is complete.

This template also adds pages to [[:Category:Articles Under Construction]].

Template:Items Needed/doc:
==Template Documentation==
The '''Items Needed''' template gives the number of items needed (rounded up) to get to a particular goal level.

===Usage===
<pre>
  {{Items Needed
      |Goal     = target level
      |Level    = current level
      |Xp       = current experience points (alternative to Level)
      |ItemXp   = the experience each item gives
  }}
</pre>

===Examples===
The first example defines the current skill status using the ''Level'' parameter:
<pre>{{Items Needed | Goal=50 | Level=43 | ItemXp = 72 }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{Items Needed | Goal=50 | Level=43 | ItemXp = 72 }}


The second example defines the actual skill status by using the ''Xp'' parameter:
<pre>{{Items Needed | Goal=50 | Xp=51234 | ItemXp = 72 }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{Items Needed | Goal=50 | Xp=51234 | ItemXp = 72 }}

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

Template:Max:
<includeonly><!--
-->{{#ifexpr: {{#if: {{{1|}}} | {{{1}}} | 0}} > {{#if: {{{2|}}} | {{{2}}} | 0}} | {{{1}}} | {{{2}}} }}</includeonly><!--
--><noinclude>
The '''max''' template is a support template that returns the maximum value of its two input parameters.

==Example==

An example of a template in use:
<pre> <nowiki> {{ Max | 4 | 5 }} </nowiki> </pre>
The example produces {{ Max | 4 | 5 }}.

Other examples are: {{ Max | 4 | 1 }}, {{ Max | 3 | }}, {{ Max | | 2 }}.<br/>
A more complex example: {{ Max | {{Max|1|2}} | 3 }}.

</noinclude>

Template:Navbox/doc:
==Usage==
This template can be used to make a standard navigation box. It is intended for use within another template that standardises the title and contents of the box, for example, [[Template:Rune running]]. In general, it SHOULD NOT be used directly within articles, as it creates a maintenance burden to do so whenever the contents of the box have to be updated.

The purpose of this template is to standardise certain attributes of all navigation boxes, for example, their colours and other CSS attributes. While at the moment the template is simple, in the future it could be extended to add other features. Using this template now allows changes like this to be implemented much quicker and easier than editing each template separately.

==Syntax==
<pre>
{{navbox
 | name    = mandatory - name of the template
 | title   = mandatory - template header

 | gtitle1 = optional - title of first group of items
 | style1  = optional - style; i.e. (line-height, font-size, etc.)
 | group1  = mandatory - list of items

 | gtitle2 = 
 | style2  = 
 | group2  = 
}}
</pre>

* Currently, the maximum number of groups allowed is '''10'''.
* Additional groups of items can be added as parameters: ''group2'', ''group3'', ..up to ''groupN''. 
* Each additional group has its own title parameter: ''gtitle2'', ''gtitle3'', ..up to ''gtitleN''.  Note that the default width for the first column is 15%.
* Style may also be customised to each group in: ''style1'', ''style2'', ''style3'', ..up to ''styleN''. 
* Note that neither the title nor items have any wiki-links built into the template.  As a result, users of the template are free to use wiki-links as they wish. 
* Line-breaks (<code><nowiki><br></nowiki></code>) are '''unnecessary''', as text wrapping is done automatically by the template.
* Because of the nature of template syntax, it may be necessary to use [[Template:!]] (<code><nowiki>{{!}}</nowiki></code>) in place of actual pipes between items, otherwise the template will ignore text after the first pipe.
** It is '''highly recommended''' that [[Template:*]] (<code><nowiki>{{*}}</nowiki></code>) be used instead.  This adds a bullet ({{*}}) instead of a pipe.

==Sub-groups==
* For larger navboxes, it may be necessary to include sub-groups within a particular group of items.  This template allows the creation of subgroups within <code><nowiki>{{navbox}}</nowiki></code>, provided that certain parameters are included:
** The nested navbox (sub-group) requires the inclusion of the subgroup parameter (''sub-group = Yes'').  This enables the template to differentiate between the nested and the parent navbox.
** The parent navbox group (i.e. ''group2'' in the example below) requires the style parameter (''style2 = padding: 0px'').  This fixes the "padding" bug that occurs when sub-groups are used.

===Syntax===
<pre>
{{navbox
 | name    =
 | title   =
 | gtitle1 =
 | group1  =
 | gtitle2 =  
 | style2  = padding: 0px (mandatory)
 | group2  = 
   {{navbox
   | subgroup = Yes (mandatory)
   | gtitle1  = 
   | group1   =
   | gtitle2  = 
   | group2   = 
   }}
}}
</pre>

==Examples==

===Use of style; without group title===
<pre style="width:95%; overflow: scroll">
{{navbox
 | name    = Rune running
 | title   = [[Rune running]]
 | style1  = text-align: center
 | group1  = [[Air running|Air]] {{*}} [[Mind running|Mind]] {{*}} [[Chaos running|Chaos]] {{*}} [[Nature running|Nature]] {{*}} [[Law running|Law]]
}}</pre>

produces:

{{navbox
 | name    = Rune running
 | title   = [[Rune running]]
 | style1  = text-align: center
 | group1  = [[Air running|Air]] {{*}} [[Mind running|Mind]] {{*}} [[Chaos running|Chaos]] {{*}} [[Nature running|Nature]] {{*}} [[Law running|Law]]
}}


===Multiple groups===
<pre style="width:95%; overflow: scroll">
{{navbox
 | name    = Amulet
 | title   = [[Amulet]]s
 | gtitle1 = Standard
 | group1  = [[Gold amulet|Gold]] {{*}} [[Sapphire amulet|Sapphire]] {{*}} [[Emerald amulet|Emerald]] {{*}} [[Ruby amulet|Ruby]] {{*}} [[Diamond amulet|Diamond]] {{*}} [[Dragonstone amulet|Dragonstone]] {{*}} [[Onyx amulet|Onyx]] 
 | gtitle2 = Enchanted
 | group2  = [[Amulet of magic|Magic]] {{*}} [[Amulet of defence|Defence]] {{*}} [[Amulet of nature|Nature]] {{*}} [[Amulet of strength|Strength]] {{*}} [[Amulet of power|Power]] {{*}} [[Amulet of glory|Glory]] {{*}} [[Amulet of fury|Fury]]
 | gtitle3 = [[Treasure Trail]]
 | group3  = [[Amulet of magic (t)]] {{*}} [[Amulet of strength (t)]] {{*}} [[Amulet of glory (t)]] {{*}} [[Third age amulet|Third Age]] 
 | gtitle4 = Translation
 | group4  = [[Camulet]] {{*}} [[Catspeak amulet|Catspeak]] {{*}} [[Ghostspeak amulet|Ghostspeak]] {{*}} [[M'speak amulet|Monkeyspeak]]
 | gtitle5 = Others
 | group5  = [[Amulet of accuracy|Accuracy]] {{*}} [[Crone-made amulet|Crone-made]] {{*}} [[Cat training medal|Cat Training]] {{*}} [[Amulet of farming|Farming]] {{*}} [[Glarial's amulet|Glarial's]] {{*}} [[Gnome amulet|Gnome]] {{*}} [[Lunar amulet|Lunar]] {{*}} [[Pre-nature amulet|Pre-nature]] {{*}} [[Salve amulet (unenchanted)|Salve]] {{*}} [[Yin yang amulet|Yin Yang]]
}}</pre>

produces:

{{navbox
 | name    = Amulet
 | title   = [[Amulet]]s
 | gtitle1 = Standard
 | group1  = [[Gold amulet|Gold]] {{*}} [[Sapphire amulet|Sapphire]] {{*}} [[Emerald amulet|Emerald]] {{*}} [[Ruby amulet|Ruby]] {{*}} [[Diamond amulet|Diamond]] {{*}} [[Dragonstone amulet|Dragonstone]] {{*}} [[Onyx amulet|Onyx]] 
 | gtitle2 = Enchanted
 | group2  = [[Amulet of magic|Magic]] {{*}} [[Amulet of defence|Defence]] {{*}} [[Amulet of nature|Nature]] {{*}} [[Amulet of strength|Strength]] {{*}} [[Amulet of power|Power]] {{*}} [[Amulet of glory|Glory]] {{*}} [[Amulet of fury|Fury]]
 | gtitle3 = [[Treasure Trail]]
 | group3  = [[Amulet of magic (t)]] {{*}} [[Amulet of strength (t)]] {{*}} [[Amulet of glory (t)]] {{*}} [[Third age amulet|Third Age]] 
 | gtitle4 = Translation
 | group4  = [[Camulet]] {{*}} [[Catspeak amulet|Catspeak]] {{*}} [[Ghostspeak amulet|Ghostspeak]] {{*}} [[M'speak amulet|Monkeyspeak]]
 | gtitle5 = Others
 | group5  = [[Amulet of accuracy|Accuracy]] {{*}} [[Crone-made amulet|Crone-made]] {{*}} [[Cat training medal|Cat Training]] {{*}} [[Amulet of farming|Farming]] {{*}} [[Glarial's amulet|Glarial's]] {{*}} [[Gnome amulet|Gnome]] {{*}} [[Lunar amulet|Lunar]] {{*}} [[Pre-nature amulet|Pre-nature]] {{*}} [[Salve amulet (unenchanted)|Salve]] {{*}} [[Yin yang amulet|Yin Yang]]
}}


===Sub-groups===
<pre style="width:95%; overflow: scroll">
{{navbox
 | name    = Rune equipment
 | title   = [[Rune equipment]]
 | gtitle1 = [[Rune weapons|Weapons]]
 | group1  = 
 | gtitle2 = [[Rune armour|Armour]]
 | group2 = 
 | gtitle3 = [[Gilded armour]]
 | group3 = 
 | gtitle4 = [[God armour]]
 | style4  = padding: 0px
 | group4 = 
   {{navbox
   | subgroup = Yes
   | gtitle1  = [[Guthix]]
   | group1   = 
   | gtitle2  = [[Saradomin]]
   | group2   = 
   | gtitle3  = [[Zamorak]]
   | group3   = 
   }}
 | gtitle5 = Ranged
 | group5 = 
 | gtitle6 = [[Runite (metal)|Other]]
 | group6 = 
}}</pre>

produces:

{{navbox
 | name    = Rune equipment
 | title   = [[Rune equipment]]
 | gtitle1 = [[Rune weapons|Weapons]]
 | group1  = ''List of items''
 | gtitle2 = [[Rune armour|Armour]]
 | group2 = ''List of items''
 | gtitle3 = [[Gilded armour]]
 | group3 = ''List of items''
 | gtitle4 = [[God armour]]
 | style4  = padding: 0px
 | group4 = 
   {{navbox
   | subgroup = Yes
   | gtitle1  = [[Guthix]]
   | group1   = ''List of items''
   | gtitle2  = [[Saradomin]]
   | group2   = ''List of items''
   | gtitle3  = [[Zamorak]]
   | group3   = ''List of items''
   }}

 | group5 = ''List of items''
 | gtitle6 = [[Runite (metal)|Other]]

}}

<span style="float:left;">[[Image:Information icon.svg|40px|Information]]</span>Hello.  An image that you have uploaded appears to be a personal image.  Personal images should not be hosted on ''RuneScape'' Wiki (''see [[RS:NOT#HOST]]''). If you want to add a picture of your RuneScape character, or any other picture that doesn't fit in an article, you can upload it on an image hosting site, such as [http://photobucket.com/ Photobucket] or [http://imageshack.us/ ImageShack]. You can then insert it into your userpage simply by copy/pasting the picture URL where you want to insert it. If you need more details feel free to ask any question you have on {{#if: {{{1|}}} | [[User talk:{{{1}}}|my talk page]] | my talk page}}.<noinclude>

== Usage ==
This template is a standard message to inform a user that they shouldn't upload personal pictures to the wiki, while helping them to upload their pictures on an image host.

<pre>{{NoPP|your username}}</pre>

Your username is optional, but will help the user to find your talk page. Most of the time, this template should be followed by your signature.

== Example ==
<pre>{{NoPP|Patheticcockroach}}</pre>
{{NoPP|Patheticcockroach}}

[[Category:Image templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
</noinclude>
Template:No Vandal:
'''<big>Vandalism</big>'''

Hello, {{PAGENAME}}, it appears that [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|you have been vandalizing the ''RuneScape Wiki'']]. Vandalism includes:

*Adding offensive comments to pages.
*Removing or blanking important content from pages or templates.
*Adding nonsense to articles or creating nonsense pages.
*Purposefully adding incorrect information to articles.
*Attacking another user.
*Advertising.
*Promoting the breaking of [[Rules Guide|Jagex's 15 game rules]].

If you have been or are doing this, please stop and try to make useful contributions or you will be [[RuneScape:User block policy|blocked]].
If you have already been blocked and you feel that the block was unfair, please contact a [[Special:Listusers/Sysop|sysop]] by leaving a message on [[Special:Mytalk|your talk page]]. A sysop will read your appeal and make a decision.

You are more than welcome to return after your block expires, if you were blocked, and make helpful contributions. Thank you.<noinclude>

==Usage==
<nowiki>{{Subst:No Vandal}} + ~~~~</nowiki> (or your [[template:signatures|signature template]])
</noinclude>
Template:Nosubst:
{{{{{1}}}}}<noinclude>

Purpose: to be used in sigs to circumvent <tt>SUBST</tt>.

Usage: in [[Special:Preferences]] in the '''Signature''' field (as raw), for example:

<pre>{{Nosubst|Template:Signatures/Yourusername}}</pre>

Which becomes:

<pre>{{SUBST:Nosubst|Template:Signatures/Yourusername}}</pre>

</noinclude>

*{{{2}}}{{#if:{{{3|}}}|
*{{{3}}}}}|{{{1}}}}}
|[[Image:Acorn(oak) Tree Seed.PNG|right]]
|}<noinclude>

==Location==
This infobox template presents a concise summary at the top of [[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines|Wikipedia policy and guideline]] pages. It is placed below the title and other infoboxes and above the first paragraph of the main body. 

==Usage==
* <pre>{{nutshell|text}}</pre>
::becomes:
{{nutshell|text}}
* <pre>{{nutshell|First bullet point|Second bullet point|Third bullet point}}</pre>
::becomes:
{{nutshell|First bullet point|Second bullet point|Third bullet point}}
* <pre>{{Nutshell|title=A nutshell|text}}</pre>
::becomes:
{{nutshell|title=A nutshell|text}}

==Template notes==
*Use the nutshell summary to make the RuneScape Wiki more inviting to [[Wikipedia:Welcoming committee|new users]]
*Nutshell entries must be brief overviews, with a very high Signal-to-noise ratio#Informal use
*Make sure each word in the nutshell carries significant weight
*Wikilink key words to other [[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines|policy and guideline]] pages to create a "nut trail"

</noinclude>

Template:ParseHiscoreData/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an iterim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==

The '''ParseHiscoreData''' template can be used to extract chosen skill levels, rank or experience from raw highscore data in the same format as returned from '''<nowiki>http://hiscore.runescape.com/index_lite.ws?player=<playername></nowiki>'''.

===Usage===
<code><nowiki>{{ParseHiscoreData| ''hiscore data'' | ''skill name'' | ''value type''}}</nowiki></code>

The ''hiscore data'' should be a string of number separated with commas and spaces in the format returned by the '''index_lite.ws'''. For example, for Zezima, this can be seen [http://hiscore.runescape.com/index_lite.ws?player=Zezima here].

{| class="wikitable"
| [[Image:Information_icon.svg|left|40px]] Rather than copying the data into each use of ParseHiscoreData, this returned text from the '''index_lite.ws''' can be saved in a user's subpage that then can be included. See examples below. <br/> When saving the data, it should be saved as one line (with spaces) copied from the browser window, not as multiple lines with line breaks (as the parse cannot handle line breaks).
|}

The ''skill name'' is the name of the skill to extract the information for. The overall levels can be extracted by specifying "overall".

The ''value type'' is the type of value to extract. If "0", then the rank is extracted. If "1", then the level is extracted (this is the default). If "2", then the experience is extracted.

===Examples===
The following template call returns the overall level of a user called ''Amaurice'', using the user's hiscore data saved in the page [[User:Amaurice/Hiscore Data]]:
<pre><nowiki>
{{ParseHiscoreData| {{User:Amaurice/Hiscore Data}} | overall}}
</nowiki></pre>

This gives the result: {{ParseHiscoreData| {{User:Amaurice/Hiscore Data}} | overall}}

The following example shows the number of experience points for the user ''Amaurice'' for the ''fletching'' skill:
<pre><nowiki>
{{ParseHiscoreData| {{User:Amaurice/Hiscore Data}} | fletching | 2}}
</nowiki></pre>

This gives the result: {{ ParseHiscoreData | {{User:Amaurice/Hiscore Data}} | fletching | 2 }}

==Updating an user's Hiscore Data pages==
User's can periodically update their Hiscore Data pages by doing the following:
# Go to the web page '''<nowiki>http://hiscore.runescape.com/index_lite.ws?player=<playername></nowiki>''' (where the '''<nowiki><playername></nowiki>''' is replaced with the real player name).
# Copy the contents of the page (e.g. using Cntl-C).
# Go to user's own Hiscore Data sub-page
# Edit the Hiscore Data page
# Select any existing text in the edit box (e.g. using Ctrl-A)
# Paste in the new data (e.g. using Cntl-V)
# Save the changes.

All pages making use of the user's hiscore data should then be automatically updated.

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>
