These pages should often be checked when changes are made visible on the [http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Special:Recentchanges Recent changes] page, to ensure they are not being targeted for vandalism.</font>
Examples of common vandalism targets are:
*Exchange pages for rare or [[discontinued items]]
**The accompanying main page of those items
*Pages such as [[Noob]] and [[Level 99 skills]] where not all of the information can be proven either factual nor completely beneficial, or is not as heavily monitored in terms of language or content, as in [[Player dictionary]]
*[[Sysop]] userpages and talk pages.

Template:Querylink/doc:
This template is shamelessly ripped from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template:Querylink Wikipedia].

Example usage:
                      ''1              qs                       2''
  <nowiki>{{</nowiki>{{BASEPAGENAME}}|Special:Allpages|qs=namespace=1|See what people are talking about}}

Where 
*''1'' is the internal webpage
*''qs'' is the URL GET query string
*''2'' is the text you want to appear

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>
Template:Quote:
<div class="quote">
:<span {{#if:{{{3|}}}|title="Source:&nbsp;{{{3}}}"|}}>"''{{{1}}}''"</span>
:&#8213;{{{2}}}{{#if:{{{3|}}}|<sup class="noprint">[[{{{3|}}}|[src]]]</sup>|<includeonly>[[Category:Unsourced quotes]]</includeonly>}}</div><noinclude>__NOTOC__
==Usage instructions==
<pre><nowiki>{{Quote|quote|attribution|source}}</nowiki></pre>

===Notes===
If any text is assigned to the ''source'' field, it will be rendered as a browser [[Wikipedia:Tooltip|tooltip]].

==Example==
====Code====
<code><nowiki>{{Quote|I'm not sure how you could confuse ME with anyone!|[[Mandrith]]|Bounty Hunter}}</nowiki></code>

====Result====
{{Quote|I'm not sure how you could confuse ME with anyone!|[[Mandrith]]|Bounty Hunter}}

</noinclude>

Template:Progress/doc:
The '''Progress''' template is used to display a progress bar.
==Usage==
<pre>
{{Progress
    |percent = an integer representing of the percentage completed.
    |width   = an integer representing the number of pixels of the bar width.
}}</pre>

==Examples==
<pre>
{{Progress}}</pre>
{{Progress}}

<pre>
{{Progress|percent=0|width=400}}</pre>
{{Progress|percent=0|width=400}}

<pre>
{{Progress|percent=75|width=300}}</pre>
{{Progress|percent=75|width=300}}


<pre>
{{Progress|percent=100|width=300}}</pre>
{{Progress|percent=100|width=300}}

Optionally a different discussion page can be specified as a second parameter.  Doing so will also include the article in [[:Category:Articles to be merged]].

Template:Reflist:
<div class="references-small" {{#if: {{{colwidth|}}}| style="-moz-column-width:{{{colwidth}}}; -webkit-column-width:{{{colwidth}}}; column-width:{{{colwidth}}};" | {{#if: {{{1|}}}| style="-moz-column-count:{{{1}}}; -webkit-column-count:{{{1}}}; column-count:{{{1}}} }};" |}}>
<references /></div><noinclude>
== Usage ==
Use this template to create a reference list in an article with a small font.

Using <tt><nowiki>{{reflist|2}}</nowiki></tt> will create a two-column reference list, and <tt><nowiki>{{reflist|3}}</nowiki></tt> will create a three-column list.

Using <tt><nowiki>{{reflist|colwidth=30em}}</nowiki></tt> will allow the browser to automatically choose the number of columns based on the width of the web browser.  Choose a column width that's appropriate for the average width of the references on the page.

Note: multiple columns currently render properly only in Mozilla Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers, though the feature is included in CSS3, so it should work for a larger number of browsers in the future.

[[Category:Reference templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

Template:RuneReq/doc:
<!-- There can be some additional doc templates here, but
     these are not (yet) supported on the RS wiki -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
= Template Documentation =

The '''RuneReq''' template displays a list of runes and numbers against them. Used for spells that give a list of number of runes needed.

==Usage==
<pre>
{{RuneReq
  | Air    = number of Air runes
  | Water  = number of Water runes
  | Earth  = number of Earth runes
  | Fire   = number of Fire runes
  | Mind   = number of Mind runes
  | Body   = number of Body runes
  | Astral = number of Astral runes
  | Chaos  = number of Chaos runes
  | Cosmic = number of Cosmic runes
  | Nature = number of Nature runes
  | Death  = number of Death runes
  | Law    = number of Law runes
  | Blood  = number of Blood runes
  | Soul   = number of Soul runes
}}
</pre>

== Example ==
The following example:
<pre>{{RuneReq | Astral=2 | Earth=1}}</pre>

Produces the following result: {{RuneReq | Astral=2 | Earth=1}}

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

Template:Scroll box:
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="width:{{{width|100%}}}; margin-bottom:3px; margin-top:3px;"><tr><td style="background :transparent;"><div style="overflow: auto; height: {{{height|230px}}}; width:{{{width|100%}}};  -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;">
{{{content|{{{1}}}}}}
</div></td><td style="width:8px;"></td></tr></table><noinclude>
==Usage==
<pre><nowiki>
{{Scroll box
|content=''Some long content''
|width=''(Optional) Width (in px or % or em)''
|height=''(Optional)Height (in px or em)''
}}
</nowiki></pre>

The general form (not changing width or height):
<pre><nowiki>
{{Scroll box|
''Some long content''
}}
</nowiki></pre></noinclude>
Template:Sectstub:
<small>''This section is a [[RuneScape:Stubs|stub]]. Please help [{{fullurl:{{FULLPAGENAME}}|action=edit}} expand it].''</small><br /><noinclude>

==Usage==
This template is used for small sections within an article. If you see a small section that could be expanded, then place <code><nowiki>{{Sectstub}}</nowiki></code> underneath the header.

==Example==
An example of using the template under a section heading:

<pre>
==Heading==
{{Sectstub}}

Text appears here.</pre>

[[Category:Maintenance templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
</noinclude>

==Usage==
This template add a shortcut box to the right of an article or a section which provides the shortcut link to that article or section.  

==Example==
'''Using:'''
<code><nowiki>{{shortcut|[[RS:SG]]}}</nowiki></code>

'''gives:'''

{{shortcut|[[RS:SG]]}}

[[Category:Maintenance templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
</noinclude>
Template:Signature/doc:
== Documentation ==
<noinclude>__TOC__</noinclude>

=== Updates ===
* Template completed 01:49, 15 January 2009 by Supertech1
* Template documentation completed 02:28, 15 January 2009 (UTC) by Supertech1
* Sub and sup styles added 02:55, 15 January 2009 (UTC) by Supertech1
* Sub and sup examples added to template 03:03, 15 January 2009 (UTC) by Supertech1
* Bold, underline, and italic options added to template and documentation 19:33, 16 January 2009 (UTC) by Supertech1
* Fixed background in IE 7; was not being displayed in signatures with images due to a bug in IE's relative positioning 22:34, 20 January 2009 (UTC) by Supertech1

=== Usage ===
<pre>
{{signature
| name              = Username of the signature's owner [REQUIRED]
| style             = Signature style; possible values: normal, sub, sup (if not specified, normal is implied)
| color             = Color of the text in the signature
| bold              = If "yes", all text is bolded.
| italic            = If "yes", all text is italicised.
| underline         = If "yes", all text is underlined.
| background        = Background color of the signature
| border-style      = Border style of the signature
| border-width      = Width of the signature's border
| border-color      = Color of the signature's border
| rank              = Rank of the signature's owner (rollback, sysop, etc.); this will determine the crown to be displayed
| button-color      = Color of the text in the link buttons (talk, contributions, edit count)
| button-background = Background color of the link buttons (only used with normal style)
| divider-style     = Style of the borders to the left and right of each link button (only used with normal style)
| divider-width     = Width of the borders to the left and right of each link button (only used with normal style)
| divider-color     = Color of the borders to the left and right of each link button (only used with normal style)
| separator         = Character used to separate each link button; defaults to &bull; (only used with sub and sup styles)
| separator-color   = Color of characters separating each link button (only used with sub and sup style)
| image1            = Image to appear to the left of username/rank icon
| image2            = Image to appear to the right of the link buttons
}}
</pre>

=== Examples ===

<tr><th style="border: solid 1px #aaa;">Signature</th><th style="border: solid 1px #aaa; border-left: none;">Code</th></tr>

Template:Signatures/Blast:
'''[[User:Blast|<font color=#DE0000>Bl</font>]][[User_talk:Blast|<font color=#FCD116>a</font>]][[User:Blast|<font color=#DE0000>st</font>]]''' <small>{{{1}}} {{{2}}} (UTC -5)</small><noinclude>
==Usage==
<code>&#123;&#123;subst:User:Blast/signature|''datestamp''|''timestamp''&#125;&#125;</code>
;date : datestamp (DD.MM.YY)
;time : timestamp (HHMM)

=== Example ===
Typing:
<code><nowiki>{{subst:User:Blast/signature|22.11.06|2216}}</nowiki></code>
will yield:<br>
'''[[User:Blast|<font color=#DE0000>Bl</font>]][[User_talk:Blast|<font color=#FCD116>a</font>]][[User:Blast|<font color=#DE0000>st</font>]]''' <small>22.11.06 2216 (UTC -5)</small></noinclude>

Template:SimpleGoal/doc:
<!-- There can be some additional doc templates here, but
     these are not (yet) supported on the RS wiki -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
= Template Documentation =

The '''SimpleGoal''' template displays a completion bar based on the amount of the goal that has currently been achieved. For skill goals, see [[Template:Goal]].

==Usage==
<pre>
{{SimpleGoal
  |Label     = optional label (replaces image of coins)
  |Goal      = target number
  |Have      = current number
  |Units     = units to display after the amount to go (e.g "gp")
  |BarColor1 = color of achieved part of progress bar (default green)
  |BarColor2 = color of remaining part of progress bar (default blue)
}}
</pre>

==Examples==
Below are some examples of the various uses of the SimpleGoal template. The first example gives the desired number of coins and the number so far:
<pre>&#123;{SimpleGoal | Goal=1000000 | Have=215000 | Units=gp }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{SimpleGoal | Goal=1000000 | Have=215000 | Units=gp }}


The second example gives the desired number of music songs and the number so far:
<pre>&#123;{SimpleGoal | Label=[[image:Music_icon.PNG]] | BarColor1=darkcyan
   | Goal=500 | Have=312 | Units=songs }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{SimpleGoal | Label=[[image:Music_icon.PNG]] | BarColor1=darkcyan
   | Goal=500 | Have=312 | Units=songs }}


The third example gives the desired number of quest points and the number so far:
<pre>&#123;{SimpleGoal | Label=[[image:Quest.png]] | BarColor1=green | BarColor2=blue
   | Goal=270 | Have=256 | Units=qp }}</pre>
The example produces the following result:
{{SimpleGoal | Label=[[image:Quest.png]] | BarColor1=green | BarColor2=blue
   | Goal=270 | Have=256 | Units=qp }}

Template:Skill clickpic/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an iterim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==
The '''Skill clickpic''' template displays a clickable skill icon picture that links to the skill page. This can be also be used in other templates that display skill icons.

===Usage===
<code><nowiki>{{Skill clickpic|''skill''}}</nowiki></code>

===Example===
Using the following code:
<code><nowiki>{{Skill clickpic|Mining}}</nowiki></code>

Produces the following result: {{Skill clickpic|Mining}}

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

<center>{{hs|{{{Name}}}|'''Skills'''}}<br>[[Image:Attack.gif|{{{Attack}}}]] [[Image:Strength.gif|{{{Strength}}}]] [[Image:Defence.gif|{{{Defence}}}]]  [[Image:Ranged.gif|{{{Ranged}}}]] [[Image:Prayer.gif|{{{Prayer}}}]] [[Image:Magic.gif|{{{Magic}}}]] [[Image:Runecrafting.gif|{{{Runecrafting}}}]]  [[Image:Construction.gif|{{{Construction}}}]] [[Image:Hitpoints.gif|{{{Hitpoints}}}]] [[Image:Agility.gif|{{{Agility}}}]] [[Image:Herblore.gif|{{{Herblore}}}]] [[Image:Thieving.gif|{{{Thieving}}}]] [[Image:Crafting.gif|{{{Crafting}}}]] [[Image:Fletching.gif|{{{Fletching}}}]] [[Image:Slayer.gif|{{{Slayer}}}]] [[Image:Hunter.gif|{{{Hunter}}}]] [[Image:Mining.gif|{{{Mining}}}]] [[Image:Smithing.gif|{{{Smithing}}}]] [[Image:Fishing.gif|{{{Fishing}}}]] [[Image:Cooking.gif|{{{Cooking}}}]] [[Image:Firemaking.gif|{{{Firemaking}}}]] [[Image:Woodcutting.gif|{{{Woodcutting}}}]] [[Image:Farming.gif|{{{Farming}}}]] [[Image:Summoning.gif|{{{Summoning}}}]] [[Image:Quest.png|{{{Quest}}}]] [[Image:CombatSwords.PNG|{{{Combat}}}]]<br><small>(hover icons for levels)
</small></center></div></includeonly>
<noinclude>

The '''Skillbar''' template provides a banner of icons for the various '''RuneScape''' skills with the player's level in each provided in the hover text.

==Usage==
The parameters for this are identical to those of [[Template:User stats]]:
<pre>
{{Skillbar
|Name          = Player name.
|Attack        = Attack level.
|Hitpoints     = Hitpoints level.
|Mining        = Mining level.
|Strength      = Strength level.
|Agility       = Agility level.
|Smithing      = Smithing level.
|Defence       = Defence level.
|Herblore      = Herblore level.
|Fishing       = Fishing level.
|Ranged        = Ranged level.
|Thieving      = Thieving level.
|Cooking       = Cooking level.
|Prayer        = Prayer level.
|Crafting      = Crafting level.
|Firemaking    = Firemaking level.
|Magic         = Magic level.
|Fletching     = Fletching level.
|Woodcutting   = Woodcutting level.
|Runecrafting  = Runecrafting level.
|Slayer        = Slayer level.
|Farming       = Farming level.
|Construction  = Construction level.
|Hunter        = Hunter level.
|Summoning     = Summoning level.
|Quest         = Questpoint number.
|Combat        = Combat level.
}}</pre>

=== Example ===

<pre>
{{Skillbar
|Name          = Rabbit
|Attack        = 1
|Hitpoints     = 2
|Mining        = 3
|Strength      = 4
|Agility       = 5
|Smithing      = 6
|Defence       = 7
|Herblore      = 8
|Fishing       = 9
|Ranged        = 10
|Thieving      = 11
|Cooking       = 12
|Prayer        = 13
|Crafting      = 14
|Firemaking    = 15
|Magic         = 16
|Fletching     = 17
|Woodcutting   = 18
|Runecrafting  = 19
|Slayer        = 20
|Farming       = 21
|Construction  = 22
|Hunter        = 23
|Summoning     = 24
|Quest         = 25
|Combat        = 26
}}</pre>

Template:SpellCost/doc:
== Template Documentation ==  <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->

The '''SpellCost''' template calculates the cost for the number of runes specified. The cost of each rune is based on real-time market prices on the [[Grand Exchange Market Watch]].  Used for calculating the costs of [[Magic]] spells.

== Usage ==
<pre>
{{SpellCost
  | Soul   = number of Soul runes
  | Blood  = number of Blood runes
  | Death  = number of Death runes
  | Law    = number of Law runes
  | Astral = number of Astral runes
  | Nature = number of Nature runes
  | Chaos  = number of Chaos runes
  | Cosmic = number of Cosmic runes
  | Body   = number of Body runes
  | Earth  = number of Earth runes
  | Fire   = number of Fire runes
  | Water  = number of Water runes
  | Mind   = number of Mind runes
  | Air    = number of Air runes
}}
</pre>

== Notes/Bugs ==
Using '''spaces''' within the template parameters seem to result in an error within the template.  Therefore, the use of spaces is strictly ''discouraged''.  See the example below for clarification.

== Example ==
The following is an example of using the template:
<pre>&#123;{SpellCost|Air=5|Law=1}}</pre>

Produces the following result: {{SpellCost|Air=5|Law=1}}

<noinclude>[[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]</noinclude>

<includeonly>{{#time: {{{1|}}} | {{{2|}}} {{#expr:

| pacific = (-8+{{dst|us|{{{2|}}}}})

+ {{#switch:{{lc:{{{4|}}}}}

}} hours}}</includeonly><noinclude>

This is a template that allows conversion of date/time from one timezone to another. Used by other templates.

=== Syntax ===

<pre>
{{Time convert|format|datetime|fromzone|tozone}}
</pre>

The '''format''' is the format for the result, using options explained [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Help:ParserFunctions#.23time: here].

The '''datetime''' should be fully specified (including the year).

The '''zone''' is the timezone that the specified '''datetime''' is in, and currently recognises the following options:
* '''pacific''' (of USA)
* '''mountain''' (of USA)
* '''central''' (of USA)
* '''eastern''' (of USA)
* '''uk''' (Britain)
* '''aus''' (Eastern Australia)

=== Examples ===

The following example:
<pre>
{{Time convert|D, j M g:i a|8:00pm 23 May 2008|uk|pacific}}
</pre>

Produces the following result:

{{Time convert|D, j M g:i a|8:00pm 23 May 2008|uk|pacific}}

</noinclude>

Template:Time countdown:
<includeonly>{{#ifexpr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}}) <= 0 | no time | {{#ifexpr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}}) <= 7200 | {{#expr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}})/60 round 0}} minutes | {{#ifexpr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}}) <= 172800 | {{#expr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}})/3600 round 0}} hours | {{#expr: ({{Time convert|U|{{{1|}}}|{{{2|}}}|utc}}-{{#time:U}})/86400 round 0}} days }} }} }}</includeonly><noinclude>

This template displays the remaining time to go until a specifed date/time.

Normally the remaining time is shown in terms of '''days''', but as the time approaches, it will switch to displaying '''hours''', and then '''minutes'''.

Once the time has been reached, the string "'''no time'''" will be returned.

=== Syntax ===

<pre>
{{Time countdown|datetime|zone}}
</pre>

The '''datetime''' should be fully specified (including the year).

The '''zone''' is the timezone that the specified '''datetime''' is in, and currently recognises the following options:
* '''pacific''' (of USA)
* '''mountain''' (of USA)
* '''central''' (of USA)
* '''eastern''' (of USA)
* '''uk''' (Britain)
* '''aus''' (Eastern Australia)

=== Examples ===

Example #1:
 <nowiki>{{</nowiki>Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|+5 days}}|uk}}

Produces the following result:
'''{{Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|+5 days}}|uk}}'''


Example #2:
 <nowiki>{{</nowiki>Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|+5 hours}}|uk}}

Produces the following result:
'''{{Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|+5 hours}}|uk}}'''


Example #3:
 <nowiki>{{</nowiki>Time countdown|{{#time:g:ia j M Y|+85 minutes}}|uk}}

Produces the following result:
'''{{Time countdown|{{#time:g:ia j M Y|+85 minutes}}|uk}}'''


Example #4:
 <nowiki>{{</nowiki>Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|-5 hours}}|uk}}

Produces the following result:
'''{{Time countdown|{{#time:g:00a j M Y|-5 hours}}|uk}}'''

</noinclude>
Template:Title:
<includeonly><div id="title-meta" style="display: none">{{{1|{{PAGENAME}}}}}</div><div id="title-align" style="display: none">{{#switch:{{{align}}}|right=right|middle|center=center|left}}</div></includeonly><noinclude>The '''Title''' template changes the appearance and the text of the main title of a page.  It can be used in any namespace, including the User namespace.  The page will still be located at the original title, but using this template will change its text and appearance.

==Usage==
*<code><nowiki>{{Title}}</nowiki></code> - removes namespace.
*<code><nowiki>{{Title|Foo Bar}}</nowiki></code> - custom title.
*<code><nowiki>{{Title|align=center}}</nowiki></code> - centered alignment
*<code><nowiki>{{Title|align=right}}</nowiki></code> - aligned to the right
*<code><nowiki>{{Title|Foo Bar|align=center}}</nowiki></code> - custom title; centered alignment

</noinclude>

Template:Training/doc:
==Template Documentation==
The '''Training''' template gives a sentence of the number of items needed (rounded up) to get to a particular goal level. Up to 4 items can be specified.

==Usage==
<pre>
  {{Training
      |Skill     = name of skill
      |Goal      = target level
      |Level     = current level
      |Xp        = current experience points (alternative to Level)
      |Item      = item used for training (e.g dragon bones)
      |ItemXp    = experience gained for each item
      |ItemCost  = individual cost of item (in gold coins)
      |Item2     = alternative item 2
      |Item2Xp   = experience for alternative item 2
      |Item2Cost = individual cost of item 2 (in gold coins)
      |Item3     = alternative item 3
      |Item3Xp   = experience for alternative item 3
      |Item3Cost = individual cost of item 3 (in gold coins)
      |Item4     = alternative item 4
      |Item4Xp   = experience for alternative item 4
      |Item4Cost = individual cost of item 4 (in gold coins)
      |Color     = text color (defaults to black)
      |AndOr     = items are "and" or "or" (default "or")
  }}
</pre>

==Examples==
The first example defines the current skill status using the ''Level'' parameter:
<pre>
  {{Training
      |Skill    = [[Prayer]]
      |Goal     = 50
      |Level    = 43
      |Item     = [[Dragon bones]]
      |ItemXp   = 72
  }}
</pre>

The example produces the following result:<br>
{{Training
|Skill    = [[Prayer]]
|Goal     = 50
|Level    = 43
|Item     = [[Dragon bones]]
|ItemXp   = 72
}}

The second example defines the actual skill status by using the ''Xp'' parameter:
<pre>
  {{Training
      |Skill    = [[Prayer]]
      |Goal     = 50
      |Xp       = 51234
      |Item     = [[Dragon bones]]
      |ItemXp   = 72
  }}
</pre>

The example produces the following result:<br>
{{Training
|Skill    = [[Prayer]]
|Goal     = 50
|Xp       = 51234
|Item     = [[Dragon bones]]
|ItemXp   = 72
}}

The third example defines multiple possible items:
<pre>
  {{Training
      |Skill     = [[Prayer]]
      |Goal      = 50
      |Xp        = 51234
      |Item      = [[Dragon bones]]
      |ItemXp    = 72
      |ItemCost  = 2346
      |Item2     = [[Big bones]]
      |Item2Xp   = 15
      |Item2Cost = 398
      |Item3     = [[Bones|Normal bones]]
      |Item3Xp   = 4.5
      |Item3Cost = 92
  }}
</pre>
The example produces the following result:<br>
{{Training
|Skill     = [[Prayer]]
|Goal      = 50
|Xp        = 51234
|Item      = [[Dragon bones]]
|ItemXp    = 72
|ItemCost  = 2346
|Item2     = [[Big bones]]
|Item2Xp   = 15
|Item2Cost = 398
|Item3     = [[Bones|Normal bones]]
|Item3Xp   = 4.5
|Item3Cost = 92
}}

Template:Unsigned:
<small>—[[User:{{{1}}}|{{{1}}}]] ([[User talk:{{{1}}}|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/{{{1}}}|contribs]]) forgot to sign this comment{{#if:{{{2|}}}|&nbsp;on &#32;{{{2}}}|}}.</small><noinclude>
==Usage==
<code>{{unsigned|''user name''|''date''&#125;&#125;</code>
;user name : Name or IP of user who left comment.
;date : Timestamp from edit history (remember to label it UTC).

The datestamp from the edit history appears in your local time that is set in your preferences. <br>
'''In order for the time to be UTC, adjust it using the difference you designated between the server time and local time.'''

==Example==
'''Typing:''' <code><nowiki>{{unsigned|User|10:10, September 10, 2008 (UTC)}}</nowiki></code>

'''will yield:''' {{unsigned|User|10:10, September 10, 2008 (UTC)}}</noinclude>

Template:User Edit:
<span style="float:left;">[[Image:Information icon.svg|40px|Information]]</span>Hello {{PAGENAME}}.  A change has been recently made to [[Special:Mypage|your user page]]. This edit was necessary in order to help keep our [http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Special:Wantedpages Wanted pages] as well as your user page clear. 

Most often, these changes include:

*Removing links to unused or recently removed images.
*Removing links to non-existant items.
*Removing links that were made in mistake.
*Removing links to pages that do not exist or have no reason to be made.

The changes that have been made are as follows:
*Links to non-existant items have been replaced with '''''Item name'''''.
*Links to non-existant templates, signatures, pages, users and images were removed completely.
*Links to non-existant user subpages will have most likely been replaced with '''''Subpage name'''''. 

If a personal picture you uploaded was recently removed, but you would like to have that picture on your page, you may upload it on an image hosting site, such as [http://photobucket.com/ Photobucket] or [http://imageshack.us/ ImageShack]. You may then insert it into your userpage simply by copy/pasting the picture URL where you want to insert it.

To prevent further edits to [[Special:Mypage|your user page]] please ensure that anything you place between [[ ]] or {{ }} is an actual page or image before you save the edit. You may use the '''Show preview''' button to check if the page or file exists. If the link is in <FONT COLOR="#FF0000">red</FONT>, then the page or file you are looking for does not exist. If you need more details feel free to ask any question you have on {{#if: {{{1|}}} | [[User talk:{{{1}}}|my talk page]] | my talk page}}.

Template:User stats/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an interim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==

The '''User stats''' template inserts a table with all skill levels into a page. All skills can be assigned a particular level in the template. In addition, the template will display the number of quest points and the combat level if provided in the parameter list. The ''Name'' parameter will insert a link to the ''RuneScape'' Hiscore page for that name.

==Usage==
<code><nowiki>{{User stats|</nowiki>''skill levels''<nowiki>}}</nowiki></code>
The template uses the common ''Skillname=number'' format. The following parameters are recognised in the template.

<pre>
{{User stats
|Name          = Player name
|Attack        = Attack level
|Hitpoints     = Hitpoints level
|Mining        = Mining level
|Strength      = Strength level
|Agility       = Agility level
|Smithing      = Smithing level
|Defence       = Defence level
|Herblore      = Herblore level
|Fishing       = Fishing level
|Ranged        = Ranged level
|Thieving      = Thieving level
|Cooking       = Cooking level
|Prayer        = Prayer level
|Crafting      = Crafting level
|Firemaking    = Firemaking level
|Magic         = Magic level
|Fletching     = Fletching level
|Woodcutting   = Woodcutting level
|Runecrafting  = Runecrafting level
|Slayer        = Slayer level
|Farming       = Farming level
|Construction  = Construction level
|Hunter        = Hunter level
|Summoning     = Summoning level
|Quest         = Quest points
|Combat        = Combat level
|Music         = Number of music tracks unlocked as shown on Music Player
|Total         = Optional - The template automatically sets your total level, but this can set it manually.
|Date          = "As of" date
}}</pre>

== Example ==
Below is an example of a user stat template for a player just arriving from [[Tutorial Island]]:

<pre>{{User stats
 |Attack       = 1  | Hitpoints = 10 | Mining      = 1
 |Strength     = 1  | Agility   = 1  | Smithing    = 1
 |Defence      = 1  | Herblore  = 1  | Fishing     = 1
 |Ranged       = 1  | Thieving  = 1  | Cooking     = 1
 |Prayer       = 1  | Crafting  = 1  | Firemaking  = 1
 |Magic        = 1  | Fletching = 1  | Woodcutting = 1
 |Runecrafting = 1  | Slayer    = 1  | Farming     = 1
 |Construction = 1  | Hunter    = 1  | Summoning   = 1
 |Quest        = 0  | Combat    = 3  | Music       = 21
 |Date         = {{LOCALDAY}} {{LOCALMONTHNAME}} {{LOCALYEAR}}
}}
</pre>

The example produces the following result:
{{User stats
|Attack       = 1  | Hitpoints = 10 | Mining      = 1
|Strength     = 1  | Agility   = 1  | Smithing    = 1
|Defence      = 1  | Herblore  = 1  | Fishing     = 1
|Ranged       = 1  | Thieving  = 1  | Cooking     = 1
|Prayer       = 1  | Crafting  = 1  | Firemaking  = 1
|Magic        = 1  | Fletching = 1  | Woodcutting = 1
|Runecrafting = 1  | Slayer    = 1  | Farming     = 1
|Construction = 1  | Hunter    = 1  | Summoning   = 1
|Quest        = 0  | Combat    = 3  | Music       = 21
|Date         = {{LOCALDAY}} {{LOCALMONTHNAME}} {{LOCALYEAR}}
}}

{{clear}}
==See also==
* [[Template:User stats (f2p)]]

Template:User stats (f2p)/doc:
<!-- The documentation is included as a whole in the template page
     which often does not show the template itself. Editing the
     page actually results in editing the actual template rather
     than the documentation. The templates to achieve a more
     sensible behaviour are missing from the RS wiki.
     As an interim measure, users should use the section edit. -->
<!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Template Documentation==

The '''User stats (f2p)''' template inserts a table with only free-to-play skill levels into a page. These skills can be assigned a particular level in the template. In addition, the template will display the number of quest points and the combat level if provided in the parameter list. The ''Name'' parameter will insert a link to the ''RuneScape'' Hiscore page for that name.

This template, unlike [[Template:User stats]], hides the members-only skills from appearing in the table.  Values entered for members-only skills, however, will be calculated for "Total level (p2p)".

==Usage==
<code><nowiki>{{User stats|</nowiki>''skill levels''<nowiki>}}</nowiki></code>
The template uses the common ''Skillname=number'' format. The following parameters are recognised in the template.

<pre>
{{User stats
|Name          = Player name
|Attack        = Attack level
|Hitpoints     = Hitpoints level
|Mining        = Mining level
|Strength      = Strength level
|Agility       = Agility level
|Smithing      = Smithing level
|Defence       = Defence level
|Herblore      = Herblore level
|Fishing       = Fishing level
|Ranged        = Ranged level
|Thieving      = Thieving level
|Cooking       = Cooking level
|Prayer        = Prayer level
|Crafting      = Crafting level
|Firemaking    = Firemaking level
|Magic         = Magic level
|Fletching     = Fletching level
|Woodcutting   = Woodcutting level
|Runecrafting  = Runecrafting level
|Slayer        = Slayer level
|Farming       = Farming level
|Construction  = Construction level
|Hunter        = Hunter level
|Summoning     = Summoning level
|Quest         = Quest points
|Combat        = Combat level
|Music         = Number of music tracks unlocked as shown on Music Player
|Total         = Optional - The template automatically sets your total level, but this can set it manually.
|Date          = "As of" date
}}</pre>

== Example ==
Below is an example of a user stat template for a player with level 10 for all skills, including members-only skills:

<pre>{{User stats (f2p)
 |Attack       = 10  | Hitpoints = 10  | Mining      = 10
 |Strength     = 10  | Agility   = 10  | Smithing    = 10
 |Defence      = 10  | Herblore  = 10  | Fishing     = 10
 |Ranged       = 10  | Thieving  = 10  | Cooking     = 10
 |Prayer       = 10  | Crafting  = 10  | Firemaking  = 10
 |Magic        = 10  | Fletching = 10  | Woodcutting = 10
 |Runecrafting = 10  | Slayer    = 10  | Farming     = 10
 |Construction = 10  | Hunter    = 10  | Summoning   = 10
 |Quest        = 0   | Combat    =     | Music       = 21
 |Date         = {{LOCALDAY}} {{LOCALMONTHNAME}} {{LOCALYEAR}}
}}
</pre>

The example produces the following result:
{{User stats (f2p)
|Attack       = 10  | Hitpoints = 10  | Mining      = 10
|Strength     = 10  | Agility   = 10  | Smithing    = 10
|Defence      = 10  | Herblore  = 10  | Fishing     = 10
|Ranged       = 10  | Thieving  = 10  | Cooking     = 10
|Prayer       = 10  | Crafting  = 10  | Firemaking  = 10
|Magic        = 10  | Fletching = 10  | Woodcutting = 10
|Runecrafting = 10  | Slayer    = 10  | Farming     = 10
|Construction = 10  | Hunter    = 10  | Summoning   = 10
|Quest        = 0   | Combat    =     | Music       = 21
|Date         = {{LOCALDAY}} {{LOCALMONTHNAME}} {{LOCALYEAR}}
}}

|id-fc=00008B
|info-c=#FFFFFF

|id=[[Image:Questicon.PNG]]
|info=This user has {{#if:{{{2|}}}|questlogs|a quest log}} {{#switch: {{NAMESPACE}}
 | User = [[{{FULLPAGENAME}}/{{#if:{{{1|}}}|{{#ifeq:{{{1}}}|y|QuestLog|{{{1}}}}}|Quest Log}}|here]]{{#if:{{{3|}}}|, [[{{FULLPAGENAME}}/{{#ifeq:{{{3}}}|y|QuestLog3|{{{3}}}}}|here]],|}}{{#if:{{{2|}}}|&#32;and [[{{FULLPAGENAME}}/{{#ifeq:{{{2}}}|y|QuestLog2|{{{2}}}}}|here]]|}}
 | #default = <span style="color: #ba0000;">here</span>
 }}.}}<noinclude>
<br clear="all">
==Usage==
<pre>
{{questlog|1=<sb1>|2=<sb2>|3=<sb3>}}
</pre>
Each of the fields links to a subpage of your user page; for example, if <tt><sb1>=questlog</tt>, a link will be created to <tt>User:<your user name>/questlog</tt>. If <tt><sb1>=QuestLog</tt>, <tt><sb2>=QuestLog2</tt>, or <tt><sb3>=QuestLog3</tt>, you may just use "y" in the respective field. For example, if <sb1>=y and <sb2>=y, <tt>User:<your user name>/QuestLog</tt> and <tt>User:<your user name>/QuestLog2</tt> will be linked to. You do not need to provide a value in every field if you do not have that many sandboxes.</noinclude>

Template:Userbox/time zone:
{{userbox
| id = UTC{{{1}}}
| id-c = #888888
| id-s = 9
| info = This user's [[wikipedia:time zone|time zone]] is [[wikipedia:UTC{{{1}}}|UTC{{{1}}}]]{{#ifexpr: {{#switch: {{{2|none}}}
| none = 0
| us = 1
| uk = 2
| aus = 3
| 0
}} and {{dst|{{{2|us}}}}} | , and he or she is currently observing [[wikipedia:daylight saving time|daylight saving time]] | }}.
| info-c = #aaaaaa
}}<noinclude>

This is a userbox that allows you to display the time zone you are observing.

== Syntax ==

<pre>
{{user time zone
 | Your offset from UTC
 | DST rule
}}
</pre>

== Usage ==

The infobox takes two optional parameters. The first is the UTC offset to be displayed, either a negative number or a positive number ''with the plus sign'', which defaults to 0. Second is the DST rule to be used, which can be set to "none" (areas that don't use DST), "us" (most of the U.S./Canada), "uk" (Europe), or "aus" (Australia, excluding Tasmania), defaulting to none. Note that this template relies on [[Template:Dst]], so the daylight savings calculations might be a bit off.

== Examples ==

<pre>{{user time zone|0|uk}}</pre>
This would be the setting for [[wikipedia:Western European Time|Western European Time]].

<pre>{{user time zone|-7}}</pre>
This setting could be used for Arizona, which doesn't use DST.

<pre>{{user time zone|-5|us}}</pre>
This would be the setting for the eastern U.S. and most of Ontario and Quebec.

<pre>{{user time zone|10|aus}}</pre>
This setting is used for New South Wales, Australia.
</noinclude>

Template:Userboxes:
{|class="userboxes" style="margin-left: {{{left|1}}}em;; margin-bottom: 0.5em; width: {{#expr:{{{columns|1}}}*242+8}}px; border: {{{bordercolor|#99B3FF}}} solid 1px; background-color: {{{backgroundcolor|#FFFFFF}}}; color: {{{textcolor|#000000}}}; float: {{{2|{{{align|right}}}}}}; {{{extra-css|}}}"
|<div style="text-align: center; font-size: 120%; font-weight: bold;">{{{1|{{{toptext|[[RuneScape:Userboxes|Userboxes]]}}}}}}</div><noinclude>
|}<noinclude>
==Purpose==
To collect images or userboxes into a single column grouping easily.  This template is not just for userboxes; it is also an efficient way of creating a column of images to run along the side of an article.
== Usage ==
<pre>{{Userboxes
| align           = Alignment (left or right). Default is right.
| left            = Any left margin value. Default is 1.
| backgroundcolor = Any web color (name or #XXXXXX hex format). Default is #FFFFFF.
| bordercolor     = Any web color (name or #XXXXXX hex format). Default is #99B3FF.
| extra-css       = Allows you to provide additional CSS style information.
| textcolor       = Any web color (name or #XXXXXX hex format). Default is #000000.
| toptext         = Changes the standard Userbox text and link. Can include wiki-markup.
| columns         = Number of columns (default is 1).
}}

Userboxes go here

{{userboxesend}}</pre></noinclude>

Template:Welcome:
==Welcome!==
{| style="border: solid 1px turquoise; background-color: #e0ffff; padding: 10px; width: 100%; color: black;"
|
[[Image:Wiki.png|120px|right]]
Hello, {{PAGENAME}}, and welcome to the ''RuneScape'' Wiki! 

Thank you for your past [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|contributions]] and taking an interest in our wiki.  If you have any trouble or need help, feel free to ask questions on {{#if:{{{1|}}}|[[User talk:{{{1}}}|my talk page]] or any other|any}} editor's talk page. Also, you could look at a [[Help:Contents|help page]] or you could shout out on the local [http://runescape.wikia.com/forum/ forums]. We hope you like it here and decide to stay!

Here are a few pages to help out new editors such as yourself:
*[[RuneScape:About|About the RuneScape Wiki]]
*[[RuneScape:FAQ|Answers to your frequently asked questions]]
*[[Help:Contents|Help pages, your first stop if you need any help]]
*[[Help:Editing|Editing help, in case you have questions on how to properly edit articles]]
*[[RuneScape:Your first article|A guide to help you create your first article]]
*[[RuneScape:Style|The style guide, containing all you need to know about formatting]]
*[[RuneScape:User page|About userpages and how to make yours special]]
*[[RuneScape:Userboxes|Adding userboxes to your userpage, in case you want to decorate!]]
*[[RuneScape:Signatures|Signature help, for customizing your very own signature]]
*[[RuneScape:Counter Vandalism Unit|What vandalism is, and where you can report it]]
*[[RuneScape:Community Portal|If you're looking for something to do, check out the 
Community Portal]]

Please sign your name on talk pages by using four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) or use the "''sign''" button ([[Image:Button sig.PNG]]) above the edit box. This will automatically produce your name and the date. Signing your comments is important, as it lets other editors know who has posted which comments. 

Again, welcome! {{{2|}}}
|}
Template:Wikibreak/doc:
<!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
__NOTOC__
==Usage==
The simplest use is to place <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak}}</nowiki></big></code> on your user and/or user talk pages and the above will be displayed, but with your user name in place of "'''Wikibreak'''".<br>
To change only the message, use <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak|message=</nowiki>''YourMessage''}}</big></code>, where ''YourMessage'' is the message you wish to use instead of the default above.<br>
For more options, see below.

===Syntax===
''Any and all parameters optional.''
<div style=width:25%><pre>{{wikibreak
| [Name]
| back      =
| type      =
| message   =
| align     =
| bgcol     =
| image     =
| noimage   =
| imagesize =
}}</pre></div>

{| cellpadding=3
|- style="text-align:left; background:#ddd;"
!width=80px| Parameter !! width=300px| Description
! Example and default
|- valign=top

| '''Name'''   || Your username or nickname.
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak | Joe | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' <nowiki>{{BASEPAGENAME}}</nowiki>
|- valign=top

| '''type'''   || Type of break: 
#exams (changes image and message)
#attempting (changes message)
#long (changes message)
#wikibreak, normal, short (the default message)  
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak | type=long | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' <nowiki>#default</nowiki>
|- valign=top

| '''back'''   || Replaces "soon" in the default message.  Deprecated.
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak | back=in January | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' soon
|- valign=top

| '''message'''    || Your own message rather than the default.
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak | message=Joe is elsewhere for now, but will check his talk page now and then. | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' "''Name'' is taking a short [[Wikipedia:Wikiholiday|wikibreak]] and will be back on Wikipedia soon."
|- valign=top

| '''align'''    || The alignment of the message. Options are "left", "center", and "right".
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak | message=Joe is elsewhere for now, but will check his talk page now and then. | align=left |...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' center
|- valign=top

| '''bgcol''' || The name (e.g. "beige") or HTML hex (e.g. "#97AAC4") specifying the template's background colo/ur.
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak ...| bgcol=pink | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' #F8EABA
|- valign=top

| '''image'''      || Filename of the image you wish to appear<br>beside the message (omitting "Image:" prefix).
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak ...| image=MyImage.jpg | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' Sunset at Huntington Beach.jpg
|- valign=top

| '''noimage'''    || To display the template without a picture.
|  <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak ...| noimage= | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' unused
|- valign=top

| '''imagesize'''  || Size of the image.
| <code><big><nowiki>{{wikibreak ...| imagesize=100px | ...}}</nowiki></big></code><br>''Default:'' 75px
|- valign=top

|}
----

This template displays various world times in a simple table.

=== Syntax ===

<pre>
{{World times|datetime|zone}}
</pre>

The '''datetime''' should be fully specified (including the year).

The '''zone''' is the timezone that the specified '''datetime''' is in, and currently recognises the following options:
* '''utc''' (also known as GMT)
* '''pacific''' (of USA)
* '''mountain''' (of USA)
* '''central''' (of USA)
* '''eastern''' (of USA)
* '''uk''' (Britain)
* '''aus''' (Eastern Australia)

=== Examples ===

The following example:
<pre>
{{World times|8:00pm 23 May 2008|uk}}
</pre>

Produces the following world times table:
{{World times|8:00pm 23 May 2008|uk}}

</noinclude>

The '''XP''' template returns the number of experience points required to reach the level of the input parameter.

== Usage ==
<tt>&#123;&#123; {{PAGENAME}} | ''level'' }} </tt>

== Example ==
<pre>&#123;{XP|43}}</pre>
Note that spaces in using the template might cause unexpected results when used in other constructs (tables, templates). The example produces the following result: {{XP|43}}
